title: Lovely Boutique Hotel
text: The Lowell is a lovely boutique hotel on the UE with good proximity to shopping and great restaurants. We highly recommend the Lowell for its location and very attentive staff -- from the front desk to housekeeping and room service. All were top notch!

title: Great location. Average service
text: Great location. Average service. Some rooms need refreshing and some maintenance. Housekeeping not great. Front desk very nice. Bedlinens and blankets could be better. Electrics in room were weird. But amazing location and boutique hotel. Peaceful.

title: Simply the Best Hotel in New York City
text:
We spent last week in NYC - the weather was cold, wet and windy.  But when we entered The Lowell we were immediately transported into an atmosphere of comfort and warmth.  The hotel has everything you expect in the top NYC hotel - the rooms are beautifully decorated, and each member of staff went out of their way to ensure  that our stay was perfect.  
The Club Room has its own special ambiance, and Jacques Bar offers wonderful cocktails and the best service. 
We have already made reservations for our next visit - we can't imagine staying anywhere else.

title: At 4.5 stars this is the most underrated hotel in NYC
text:
Why did I ever stay anywhere else when in NYC? To be clear, I like quiet, sophisticated well appointed hotels where guest experience/satisfaction are not just words on a website. 
Our suite had a wood burning fireplace for Pete’s sake!
Great food 
Sublime service 
Beautiful ambience 

Do yourself a favour when in NYC stay at this hotel.

title: My trip
text: A better experience does not exist. The entire staff is thoughtful, professional and friendly. I had a small problem the plumbing in my room and the situation was resolved immediately and professionally and I was moved to a new room. I felt so cared for. I cannot imagine staying anywhere but with The Lowell and I have been coming for over 30 years.

title: A Jewel
text: My husband and I have stayed at a number of Upper East Side Hotels and can say that we've found the best. The Lowell is exceptional in every way: service, amenities, the property, the dining...We have already made a reservation to come back.

title: Beautiful
text:
Great and stunning ambience , great cocktail menu , had the spaghetti in tomato sauce , such a simple dish and so well done. Classy and élégant , adorned with flowers everywhere
with an intimate ambience and I will definitely be back 
The staff were truly wonderful and I’ve been here many times

title: Best hotel in NYC
text: To stay at The Lowell is like coming home to a private refuge. Everyone on staff treats you like an honored guest. The rooms and suites (some with working fireplaces) are beautifully decorated and maintained. Quiet perfection in the middle of Manhattan.

title: European experience in NYC
text: Exceptional service and attention to detail.  Inviting and feeling of staying in a well attended home.  Went beyond our expectations and look forward to our next stay.  Every detail was thought about ahead and delivered with precision.

title: My First Lowell Experience
text: I have stayed in just about all of the NYC heavy hitting hotels and this is in my top two. The Lowell will forever be my NYC winter hotel!!  I loved the warm coziness of the hotel and how absolutely chic it was. The service was impeccable and the room was pure luxury. I've found my calmness in a city of madness. :)

title: Beautiful, spacious with great service and in room fireplace
text: Gorgeous hotel with spacious suites and a fireplace in the room which we used every day. Jacques Bar was a standout as was the friendly service. Concierge was very helpful in obtaining restaurant reservations. Doorman was terrific.

title: Best Hotel experience EVER!!!!!
text:
Don't change a single thing!!!!
My niece and I want to make this an annual trip!!!!!We had a TRIUMPH of a time!!!!!!!!
My favorite city, my favorite hotel and MY FAVORITE PEOPLE!!!!! THANK YOU FROM THE BOTTOM OF MY HEART!!!!! LOVE LOTS, SUSIE CORRIGAN

title: One of Our Favorite Hotels
text: Comfortable, clean and beautiful rooms with top notch service from friendly staff. 1 bedroom suite with fireplace was beautifully decorated and spacious. We enjoyed dinner on a rainy night in the hotels restaurant and was happily surprised by service and excellent cuisine.

title: A Gem Of A Hotel.
text:
The Lowell, with it's breathtaking entrance and art/antique clad spaces, is a NYC landmark hotel,, front door steps away from the retail outposts of Madison & Fifth avenue and the Central Park playgrounds. My Deluxe Junior Suite was very accommodating with seating space and a ivy laced landscaped terrace. Fresh flowers, curated art work, hardwood floors, desk and armchair rendered a residential feel to the environment. Classic casement windows that opened, provided natural light, fresh air and cityscape views. A wood burning fireplace elevated the coziness of the space. A marbleized bath was outfitted with separate soaking tub and shower, dual basins and heated floor. The Lowell is endowed with an array of eating and drinking venues. The Majorelle is a restaurant offering a menu of French classics fused with Moroccan influences. The decor of the Majorelle is "well dressed" with beautiful floral arrangements and table settings. Luxurious dishes from the menu include: Snails in Puff Pastry, Grilled Branzino, Roast rack of Lamb, Duck Breast and Pistachio Souffle (the house specialty). I tried the Lobster Risotto....excellent.......and I didn't pass on dessert.....Mille Feuille.....a gem of a sweet. Seasonal bar bites and coveted cocktails can be had at Jacques Bar with a decor inspired by the beautiful Majorelle Garden of Marrakesh (I loved the Moroccan Mint Tea). The Club Room is an absolutely sumptuous communal place where one can enjoy a drink and/or a small bites menu. The Pembrooke Room is a renowned European emporium available for daily breakfast, brunch and afternoon tea.
So, if you want the intimacy of a small luxury hotel with beautiful surroundings coupled to impeccable service................then try the Lowell Hotel............................
.............a gem of a hotel.

title: The best
text:
If you want a classic nyc experience then this is your place!
Service is impeccable 
Hotel feels like a glamorous town house 
The staff is warm and takes the time to ask and help with whatever you will need
We have been staying for the past 6 years and will never stay anywhere else!

title: Luxurious Stay during the Holidays
text: What a great stay! From John the bellman, to Job at the front desk. Pierre in guest relations, and Charles in room service. Everyone was so kind and welcoming. The hotel was so beautifully decorated for the holidays and just felt so warm. the suite was gorgeous and the bathrooms even more!!

title: 5 Star Disappointment
text: the hotel is nice but in my opinion NOT a 5 star hotel. A 5 star hotel should have certain things. one it should have 24 hour room service. Also it had as it's coffee in the room instant( lol.What is this I thought a Soviet Union 5 star hotel) I should not have had to call the hotel engineer to get the water hot enough to take a shower. title: The perfect hidden gem (I do not even want to post this!)
text: This hotel leaves you feeling like a local, surrounded by residential homes, we found this area to provide the best New York experience away from all the crowds. The staff is top notch and the amenities equally as good. If you are wanting to be in the midst of the NYC tourist bustle, this is not your place. If you want luxury rooms, with quality staff, excellent sips and bites, and a fabulous lounge to enjoy at the end of the day - this is your place. Perfect for couple trips or families with older (18+) children.

title: Perfect stay in all respects
text: This hotel is so perfect in every respect that it’s unfair to its competition. Everyone who works there was enormously friendly and accommodating m. The rooms were beautiful and immaculately maintained. The dining room for breakfast was lovely and the breakfasts were excellent. This hotel is the epitome of Five Star.

title: A classy place to stay in Upper East Side
text: Excellent hotel in the best Upper East side. Highly professional staff, good rooms, excellent restaurants. The hotel is small, alllowing for very personal and excellent service to all requests - concierge outstanding, reception team very efficient and friendly, rooms in perfect condition.

title: bait and switch
text: Booked trip for my husband and my anniversary many months before trip.  Made it very clear that we would love a special room so we booked a junior deluxe suite.  Was told it would have a terrace and kitchenette plus website claims the deluxe suites are corner rooms.  Called 2 weeks before to confirm nice room with terrace etc and were assured it would be a special room.  Check in to find that there was no terrace, no kitchenette and it was not a corner room.  Was stuffed into the smallest junior room not a deluxe junior suite.  Front desk could not move us into a better room and also would not reduce the price of the room given that there was no terrace, no kitchenette and it was not a bright corner room.  Very dishonest.  Also the heat was not working properly in our room so the suggestion by the bellman was to turn the heat up to 80 degrees.  Still cold and we were charged for the firewood and the log tax for our stay.  Hidden costs and quite frankly appaling given that our room was freezing.  We have stayed at many nice hotel in NYC and have always given glowing reviews.  This 5 star hotel is more like a 3 star that is outdated and extremely overpriced for what you get.

title: Another perfect stay
text: When winter gets cold and dark, nothing brightens the mood like a four day stay at the Lowell. New York City is crazy this time of the year but the Lowell is a serene oasis hidden on the Upper East Side. The decor is fresh and lovely while remaining peaceful and reserved. The more times we visit, the more we love it. The staff are engaging and always one step ahead of your needs. The rooms are elegant with soft tones and lush appointments. The suite we had this time had a fireplace, a stocked kitchen, and a huge white marble bathroom. Housekeeping kept the room clean and perfect. We have thought of buying a place in NYC but decided that we couldn’t give up the Lowell.

title: Two night stay
text: The building has amazing charm. Service was great. Prices for the in room snacks and drinks too high considering the price you pay to stay here. The restaurant was way too crowded to enjoy but located close to many excellent spots to eat. No windows with any view in our room. Much better than any of the commercial chain places to stay

title: 5 star all around
text: It’s my first time at Lowell. And I absolutely loved everything about it. Super amazing staff and so delicious food. Conveniently located where I can walk to many shops and restaurants. But I did not need to go anywhere for my meals since Lowell has great restaurants inside. ❤️❤️❤️

title: Am Excellent Hotel to be recommended
text:
I would recommend this hotel to friends in the future

title: Topnotch
text: Room quality--both aesthetics and functionality--club room (wow!), location and, most especially, service were top of the line. Most impressed by the friendliness of staff--not stuffy at all. Old New York decor with modern flourishes make for a comfy and inviting home away from home. You'll sleep well--beds are amazing.

title: Hunter Pierson Family
text: We loved the Lowell Hotel. There were 7 family members in our group and there are no complaints. We attended plays and museums, but staying at The Lowell was the highlight for everyone.  The staff is so professional and friendly. They spoiled us with wonderful treatment. We look forward to coming back to your amazing hotel.  Best, Hunter Pierson.

title: A home from home
text: A really excellent hotel. Very convenient location. Charming staff and helpful too. The rooms are very well appointed and the beds are very comfortable. The restaurant is well worth visiting and the intimate bar a great place to meet up with friends

title: home from home
text: most friendly hotel ,,best service..staff  were very alert to anything we needed..rooms were good sized and regularly serviced (cleaning/ minibar etc)..food at the bar and at breakfast was great..location is ideal..

title: A definitive choice
text: I have looked at staying here a few times over the years but usually ended up around midtown due to ease of subway access.  This year I decided it was time to see if this hotel really lived up to the reviews and to be honest who doesn’t live a wood burning fireplace in your room.  That being said this hotel is a completely different New York experience. I say that as someone who has been visiting yearly for almost 25 years.  The hotel service was 5 star.  The food excellent. The rooms well done.  (I would say I didn’t love the mattress and it probably needs to be replaced. Felt a little low quality for a hotel on this level.  But beyond all this we loved the warmth and cozy feel this hotel offered.  It didn’t feel crowed or loud. In fact it was so quiet I forgot I was in New York.  lol. There is definitely a draw for someone wanting a good place to find a calm spot to retire to after a day or night in the city that never sleeps.  We will most definitely be returning.

title: Best in NY

The restaurant Majorelle is an absolute pleasure and what fine dining should be and once was.  As always, John Mark the concierge is a true professional.  Thank you Lowell.

title: A fabulous hotel.

text: Though we basically stumbled on the Lowell it proved to be a game changer for us. The quiet professionals who pervade the entire property are just the best. We loved our room and our bathroom which had remarkably good water pressure. I loved reading in the parlor while my husband was out. Previously I was thinking my NYC jaunts might be over but now I know they are not. Many thanks to all.

title: Wonderful hotel
text: One of the great small hotels in NYC. We have been coming for 20 years and always enjoy our stays at the Lowell hotel. They make you feel like its home. The front desk and is very friendly and the bellman and doorman have been at the hotel for many many years and remember their guests.

title: Old world courtesy in a beautiful East Side gem
text: The Lowell is in many ways an anachronism; smallish and no vestiges of even a luxury chain. From the moment you arrive you are treated like old friends. The front desk personnel are professional, helpful and always positive. Same for housekeeping, doormen and breakfast experiences. Hard to overpraise this wonderful NYC classic.

title: A HOTEL THAT LIVED UP TO ITS EXPECTATIONS AND THEN SOME!
text: It is no wonder the Lowell was rated by Travel & Leisure as the number 1 best hotel in New York City and the number 1 best city hotel in America year after year.  They earned it and totally lived up to their expectation during our most recent stay.  The property is stunningly gorgeous.  The Club room is one of the most tastefully appointed public spaces I've ever seen in any hotel. Kudos to the decorator who was able to achieve such an intimate and charming ambiance in a fairly large space.  We tried to lounge there as often as we could.  We didn't get a chance to eat at their Michelin Star-rated fine dining restaurant La Majorelle, named after the beautiful Majorelle Gardens of Marrakesh that we had the pleasure and fortune of visiting just a few months prior, but their other food outlet the Bar Jacques did not disappoint.  I think their crab cakes and that goat cheese salad I had were the best I've ever tasted in my life.  Who knew you could get such great-tasting crab cakes outside of Maryland lol! These put them to shame.  And the green pea risotto was to die for.  Everything just tasted so refined and curated using the highest quality ingredients and attention to detail.  As for the rooms, we got upgraded to the junior suite thanks to the generosity and graciousness of the Front Desk Manager - I do not remember his name - but wow were we floored by that last-minute change to our room.  They actually checked us into one of their standard rooms as per our booking but then surprised us within mere minutes of arrival to tell us they were transferring all our luggage to the Junior Suite which was just the best birthday gift ever!  Even the standard rooms are gorgeous, spacious, and impeccably decorated with a wood-burning fireplace, marble bathrooms, etc but the Junior suite is a feast for the eyes complete with a kitchenette that came in handy as we needed to prepare our dog's meals in there and a bathroom the size of a mini football field lol, also with marble from head to toe.  The other really unique and special amenity of this hotel is they are so uber generous with their towels.  I counted something like 20 towels in all sizes and all perfectly folded and all embroidered with the hotel's very regal-looking insignia.  With all that said, what sets this hotel apart from the rest, and probably why it earns first place every year by the most reputable and credible travel magazines, is its service.   The staff are just the friendliest most down to earth most eager to help staff on the planet.  From the doorman Pedro to the check-in people like Hugo and that other super lovely African American lady, again I forgot her name (sorry), and also the incredibly helpful and knowledgeable concierge - we were always in the most capable hands.  We brought our dog with us on this trip and each and every staff member just doted on her making her feel like the most pampered and loved guest.  Irina our cleaning lady who is super dog friendly being a dog parent herself was just the nicest ever.  She came in each evening to turn down our room despite the doggie being there and asked us her name from the onset of our trip so that she could call her by her name when commanding her to sit or stay so that she could get on with her work.  I thought that was super clever and really appreciated these little touches that make you feel right at home.  The company's mission statement is to make the hotel feel like your home away from home.  They have achieved that unequivocally, wholeheartedly, and most sincerely as well.  I would gladly return to the Lowell which I would be honored to call my second home:) Thank you to the entire team for making our stay most memorable, most luxurious, and of course most comfortable.

title: Schöner Aufenthalt
text:
Wir haben drei Nächte im Lowell Hotel verbracht.

Unser Aufenthalt war sehr schön, entspannend und diente uns als Ruhe Oase - ein guter Kontrast zum geschäftigen New York.

title: Fabulous weekend stay and Bridal Shower
text: From entering the Lowell and smelling the lovely flowers to leaving with the doorman helping you out, it is a fabulous experience.  The hotel is beautiful and the staff are extremely welcoming and accommodating.  The location is a quiet area, just a quick walk to central park for a lovely morning stroll.  We hosted our daughter's Bridal Shower in the Club Room and stayed a long weekend.  The shower was a fabulous time for all of our guests with the service and food beyond our expectations.  We have stayed at the Lowell several times and feel like we are home when staying there and will return again!  Every room we have stayed in is beautifully decorated with luxury furniture and linens.  You leave refreshed and rested!  Thank you for providing a fabulous stay and experience.

title: Perfect home away from home
text: We just enjoyed another wonderful week at The Lowell.  It remains one of the best hotels in the U.S.  From the welcome at the front door, to the housekeeping staff, each member of the team makes us feel like VIP guests.  They remember us by name, and never forget to follow up on the simplest of requests.  The rooms are quiet and beautifully decorated.  The entire staff is dedicated to making our stay perfect.  It's why we regard the Lowell as our New York home away from home, and why we keep returning.

title: Best hotel in NY
text: We had a truly amazing experience in the best part of Manhattan,close to the museums so dear to us.It’s a jewell tucked away from the noise of Manhattan,a home from home.A hotel the one is very likely to return to.

title: Friendly and accommodating
text:
This is such a special place.  The staff, top notch, friendly, and attentive. 
The restaurant and bar are par excellence! 
This was a special trip with my niece and the staff did everything to make this a memorable experience. 
The Lowell is my place of choice next time I am visiting New York.

title: An Eastside Gem
text: Finally a Manhattan luxury hotel with more space to stretch out. A bathroom suite, large shower excellent accoutrement. And a real key for your door!  True throwback boutique experience and married to Majorelle  Maginfique!  One idea--Add a full length mirror in the hallway...

title: Serenity in Bustling NYC
text:
We recently enjoyed a wonderful 7 night stay at the Lowell. We very much appreciated receiving a complimentary upgrade to a spacious junior suite. We love the residential neighborhood in the heart of the city which is walking distance to the theater district, great shopping and restaurants yet seems a world away from the overcrowded, chaotic scene in Time Square. 

 All of the staff from the doormen, front desk, and the gentlemen serving breakfast in the Pembroke Room were friendly, kind and professional. The hotel is very clean, well-maintained and our room was so peaceful. We heard no noise from other hotel guests or banging doors which is often an annoyance at other hotels. We look forward to returning to the Lowell Hotel for our next stay in NYC.

title: Home away from home
text: The service and accommodations are first rate.  The level of care for us, including the dog, makes it our first and only choice in the city.  The location is excellent and the care and feeding (Marjorelle, Pembroke Room, Jacques Bar) are outstanding.

title: highly recommended
text: This past weekend my wife and I stayed in the Garden Suite and our sons stayed in the suite directly above us. While the Garden Suite was a bit pricey, I could not recommend either suite any more. This hotel provided (across the board) what could have been the best service we have ever received, starting with Patricia in reservations. Each touch point we experienced was completely friendly and accommodating. The main balcony in the Garden Suite (it actually contains two balconies) was a great location to chill. I would rate this hotel as a true five star hotel.

title: Lovely hotel with exceptional service
text: The moment you walk in you feel wanted.  The staff is so well trained and they make you feel part of the family.  The hotel is old but rooms are well appointed even with enough plugs and USB ports for your electronics.  The bathrooms seem remodel all in marble.  They do not skimp on towels which I appreciate.  The only con is the elevator is very small and the hallways are small but once you get in your room it is prefect.  The windows also open if you need to get fresh air.  Room service is prompt.  Will stay again.

title: What was and is not
text: The Lowell Hotel was for many decades a home away from home to me and my family. I stopped going since I moved to London but needed to go back to New York for surgery. I had the best memories of the Lowell, Arman, Tony, Margaret at reservations... Upon arrival, I found the suite quite run down, scraped furniture, old rugs and paint. It had definitely  changed. House keeping was a desaster. I needed some hand towels to freshen up as I had surgery. Has to beg to get these every day as well as a sized robe for my stay. Never got it. Then they took my phone from my room and then said sorry it was taken by mistake wtih the linen. The room service staff were not very accommodating under my special circumstance. There is a lot of room for improvement by the managing team.

title: Best place to stay for memorable visit to NYC!
text: My family was celebrating some milestones together and could not have picked a better place all around!  It accommodated the needs of our group 84yrs old to 12yrs old.  I wouldn’t change a thing about our stay!

title: Gem in NYC
text: A great location tucked away but yet near so much NY action!  The room was quiet and so comfortable.  Of course, the dining is some of the best in the US (even the bar food is good go go to Majorelle for a dining treat).  This was our first visit to the Lowell (second to Majorelle).  And we shall return for both!

title: Classic
text: NY as a New Yorker. Loved the location, the service, the food, the room. Outside is going though a retrofit, so not beautiful. The only minus is the elevator that could be faster (in doubt if both of them were working simultaneously)

title: Just stunning!
text:
Ahhhh possibly now one of our most favourite hotels in the world.

Our first visit here after many visits to lots of different nyc hotels and we would definitely want to come back here.

We stayed for our son’s 21st birthday - who is a UK student studying at Columbia. He too fell in love with the hotel. It was FABULOUS in every way and we are British hoteliers with 4 of our own. 

They made our son feel special with a cake and sparkling wine in his room. I had a bit of a nightmare trying to find decorations/balloons to decorate his room as a surprise with not much help from concierge and nothing to buy in any nearby shops, compared to England where they sell this stuff everywhere but we did the best job we could at short notice.

All the staff were fabulous. Although I would say, my son being overwhelmed and exhausted, on checking out, forgot to pack some expensive champagne - Veuve Cliquot - and beautiful macarons we bought him at great expense and a giant bag of Red Vines candy. Within 3 hrs of leaving the room they had disappeared, even though we hadn’t officially left the hotel, they still had all our bags whilst we went shopping. I just think housekeeping should be meticulous at handing things in, to be held for say 48hrs rather than taking the stuff. The hotel were very kind and let us have some of their frozen macarons and a different bottle of champagne, but the staff should be trained to hand in ANYTHING found in the rooms when you’re paying this much to stay in a boutique hotel. 

Special mention must go to the receptionists, breakfast staff and doormen, they really made our trip.

title: Beware
text: I have been looking forward to staying at the Lowell for a long time. After all, it was rated number one in New York City by many! Walking into the lobby was unimpressive to say the least, but when when we were shown to our rooms, I was in absolute shock. The wallpaper was peeling, the carpets were stained and the room was generic and looked like a motel six. The room our traveling companions were staying in were just as bad, if not worse. They looked nothing like the rooms on the website. It was clear we were given those rooms because we were not celebrities. We were treated like third class citizens. I would like to give a shout out to Tony, who was the one bright spot in a completely disastrous experience. The Lowell should be ashamed of itself for charging these kind of prices. Stay far far away from this hotel.

title: Flawless
text:
What a classy, understated and beautiful hotel. Staff and service were flawless. We were in a renovated room which was very chic. Loved the complimentary champagne upon arrival. I also loved the fresh flowers everywhere. A really elegant upper east side experience.

The only minor gripes were no coffee machine in the room (which for the price point you’d expect) and that you can’t stream from your phone to the room tv. An engineer had to come and install an Apple TV so that we could listen to Spotify in our room. Small things that can be easily fixed.

Loved it though and would definitely come back!

title: Another Perfect Stay
text: The Lowell always feels like our home away from home. Our Junior Suite had a terrace and a fireplace. It was lovely!!  The staff are what set the Lowell apart. Throughout the hotel, everyone who works there is delighted to see you and eager to make your stay perfect. They succeed at every turn. We can’t wait to get back there.

title: Lowell Hotel Experience
text: Wonderful intimate hotel, perfectly located, with very knowledgeable concierge and bellman service.  Great breakfast room and cozy lounge for delicious cocktails.  Majorelle provides delicious food with an excellent wait staff.

title: First Class
text: The Lowell Hotel is a boutique hotel in an amazing, quiet, convenient location. The staff are friendly, attentive, hard working, good people. The ambience is warm, cozy, elegant, beautiful and welcoming. The bar, restaurant and second floor Pembrook Rooms are top notch. I love this place and I will continue to return. I felt at home here!

title: Love this hotel❤️

Love the people at the front desk, the men at the front door, the beautiful living room, the servers at the bar and the most beautiful room! Great location, too! Excellent breakfast every morning. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Lowell Hotel. Everyone was friendly and helpful. We were welcomed on our arrival with a special drink. Our room was lovely and the dining was delicious.
Great location for shopping and restaurants.

title: Fantastic New York Hotel
text: Recently, we spent a few days at the Lowell with our older grandchildren.  If this review had six stars, I would check all six.  The staff was extraordinarily accommodating, prompt, neat, and efficient.  We had an issue with our departing flight, and they said, "Stay in the room as long as you need to."  No effort was made to make us store our luggage with the bellman.  It is important to note that it is a boutique hotel and not a major glitzy spot.  We have stayed at the Lowell a few times and have been lucky enough to see someone very famous during each stay.  It must be the right spot!  The Pembroke Room where breakfast is served is elegant, and the food is outstanding.  Dinner at Majorelle was very good, although very expensive.  If you enjoy well-located, small, quiet hotels, this location, a block and a half from Central Park, is perfect for you.

title: NYC Trip
text: Absolutely FABULOUS! The hotel is warm, welcoming and comfortable. Such a nice respite to return to after long days walking around in the city. Staff goes out of their way to be kind, accommodating and make you feel like family.

title: An Elegant Jewel Box.
text:
Tucked away in Upper Manhattan, amidst the brownstones on E. 63rd streets, is the Lowell Hotel. It's a hop-skip-and-jump from the fashion houses of Madison Avenue, a few steps from 5th Avenue, Central Park and NYC's most notable museums.

I appreciated my spacious, luxuriously designed Lowell room with oak floors, fresh flowers and decor in pale blue and neutral colours. It emanated a residential feel with custom headboards, antique oriental rugs, unique furniture and desk. The massive marbleized bath featured a separate tub and shower.

The Lowell has a fleet of dining options. The Majorelle is a Mediterranean inspired eatery couched in a Chateau-like dining room with a petite skylit garden. The menu displayed exciting food fare like Sea scallops with parsnips to Loin of Venison. I selected Snails (in puff pastry), Rack of lamb and a dessert of Chocolate Mousse......a delicious ensemble. Jacques Bar serves light fare and inventive cocktails while the Club Room, a quaint facility, is open to hotel guests only during the day hours serving off a small menu. The Pembroke Room serves a traditional breakfast for guests only. Service is supreme here.......catering to every guest's whim. A spacious in-house fitness centre allowed me to follow my exercise regime on the road.

So, if you would like over-the-top accommodations, top-notch dining and a near perfect attraction location.....then try the ........Lowell.........An Elegant Jewel Box.

title: Brilliant
text: We had a lovely, peaceful weekend at this elegant hotel. If you have the opportunity, choose the Lowell. The staff is attentive yet understated. The hotel is beautifully appointed and will not disappoint.

title: Hidden Gem

The feature restaurant, Majorelle, is just fabulous and is not to be missed. Staff was gracious and welcoming.  Suites are a little pricy but worth the extra fare.  Easy walk to great shopping and dining.

text: If you’re looking for the ultimate boutique hotel that provides exceptional service, looks no further. Everything from the beautiful design to the shampoo and conditioner to even the ice cubes was nothing short of amazing. We will definitely be back!

title: NYC January 2023
text: Always a friendly, courteous and professional staff.  Pembroke room is beautiful place to have breakfast.  Jaques Bar is an excellent place to eat and drink.  The upper east side location is one of the best!

title: Romantic sejour at The Lowell
text:
The Lowell is an amazing place to stay in NY.
We spent few days there and enjoyed the facilities including a dinner at Majorelle.
The courtesy of the team at the reception desk and bell man have been very much appreciated on top of reservation team for their efficiency.

title: Awesome Boutique Hotel
text: We stay away from large chain hotels.  This is one of my favorites in the city.  Rivals The Surrey, which closed down. The library on the first floor is lovely, and we sit there often.  The service is perfection.  Our room was dead quiet - which is rare in Manhattan.

title: An outstanding Upper East Side getaway
text: This is an outstanding hotel.  Very boutique and quite private.  Easy access to Central Park and all manner of shopping.  The area is a little quiet if you are looking for night life but that was fine for us.

title: Incredible stay
text: One of the finest hotel experiences ever ! Could not have asked for anything more . WOW! Treated me like family and was extremely helpful during surgery recovery. I don't think I've ever been treated better in any other hotel experience. Thank you for an amazing experience. I will always stay at the Lowell in NY.

title: Annual NYE in NYC!!!
text: The Lowell is an elegant, service oriented boutique hotel with an ideal location.  My husband and I spend New Years Eve in New York Ciry every year.  For many years we stayed at another hotel very close to The Lowell.  This other hotel closed during Covid much to our disappointment.  We booked The Lowell because it sounded similar and was in our desired location.  We are so thrilled to have connected with The Lowell. It turned out to be even better than our original favourite in ever way; Luxury, service, location, food.  Majorelle was our best meal in NYC and it is located within the hotel. You will not be disappointed.

title: Best Hotel in the World
text: The location is perfect--Lincoln Center is its across the park, the museum's are a short walk away and the park is almost at your door.  The rooms are comfortable and beautifully maintained.  The staff are all welcoming and attentive to every guest's needs.  they make it feel like returning home when we arrive.

title: Townsend
text:
Outstanding.
Home away from home.
Size of suite and the fireplace are outstanding.
Room service, bell service, housekeeping service incredibly fast and friendly.
Have nothing but "GREAT" to say about The Lowell.

title: one of the best hotels in NYC
text:
This is a small intimate hotel in a great location just around the corner from the Guggenheim and central park.
The Staff offer excellent service and attention to detail. 
 Nothing is too much trouble - everyone is very knowledgeable and always on hand

title: Our favorite hotel
text: Our fourth trip to the Lowell this year. We keep coming back because it always exceeds expectations. The staff make you feel like family. The hotel is small, understated and elegant. The location is perfect. I wish that we were still there.

title: The best hotel in NY.  The staff, rooms, and restaurants were excellent. I like the intimacy of the small hotel. It’s li
text:
My room had a fireplace which the staff prepared daily.  In room dining was prompt and very good.   Tickets for shows and dining reservations were handled to perfection. The Club bar was a great place to eat before and after the shows.
Hotel is beautiful.  Love it.  Have been staying there for about twenty years.

title: Great hotel
text: Great hotel.  Small and intimate. They make you feel  very welcome and are very attentive. Love the location. Staff was outstanding.  Not stuffy at all. Breakfast room is very nice and again staff is outstanding there as well.

title: Smart hotel but
text: We stayed in this beautifully decorated hotel for two nights. While the room was rather small the bathroom facilities and comfort were exceptional. We were disappointed that there was no coffee machine in the bedroom, only sachets of coffee granules and no fresh milk. We found the breakfast service to be slow and inefficient and the breakfast itself of only average quality. The Majorelle restaurant and adjacent bar were excellent but rather overpriced, even for a 5.star hotel. In terms of service, we fellt that the hotel fell short of other 5 star hotels we have stayed in. While the front desk staff were polite and generally efficient we felt that for 1300 dollars a night, other services which we paid for, such as tea in the lounge, charged at 40 dollars for 2, could have been complimentary. We did not receive the bill as requested by email and had to ring three times to find someone who could deal with this  after being transferred twice to an answer machine. All in all we did not find the service as welcoming and caring as one would expect from this level of hotel.

title: Great boutique Hotel just off of Central Park
text: This is a very charming Upper East Side hotel that feels like a cozy, well appointed,  old condominium building.  The block is quiet and has a very residential feel to it.  Two blocks from Central Park and 5 minute walk to the shops on 5th Avenue.  The Hotel has an old school, clubby feel to it.  If you are looking for a big hotel with spacious lobby and bar area this is not the place for you.  Lobby is very small but welcoming.  Lounge downstairs is extremely comfortable and well decorated - fireplace with very comfortable couches and a library vibe - my favorite place in the hotel.  Bar is very nice, but can probably accommodate 20-30 people max.   We stayed in a suite on 4th Floor - room was clean and spacious, as was the bathroom.   Gym very small but has nice new equipment and complimentary sport drinks and snacks on offer.  I would not hesitate to stay here again.  Staff amongst the friendliest and most accommodating I have experienced in NY City.   Clientele tended toward older couples and families.  It is not a scene, which suits me just fine.  Great stay.

title: The best boutique hotel in NYC
text: My husband and I had the best stay at the Lowell. It was the perfect escape after a busy and long day in the city. The staff was incredibly friendly and the accommodations are beautiful and comfortable. My second stay here and don’t plan to stay anywhere else when visiting NYC.

title: Appalling Experience
text:
Shocking how I got an appalling room view with a NYC backyard /alley. They could not accommodate a better room so I check into another hotel! 
To add insult to injury, they charged me full amount for my days of stay - to be reimbursed within 10 working days, while I informed them that I am checking out the same day! Still they charged me for the whole stay!!! INCREDIBLE!! NEVER NEVER AGAIN!!!

title: Our Favorite for Decades
text: We have stayed exclusively at the Lowell when in NYC over the past 20+ years. It truly feels like we’re home when we walk into the lobby. The Lowell’s elegance is understated, its suites are warm and personal, and its staff friendly, highly professional, efficient, and low key. The Lowell is a well-defined cut above most.

title: The Lowell NYC
text: Amazing Hotel and Staff. Looking forward going back to NYC to stay at the Lowell.  Location extremely convenient on quiet side of 63rd Street and Madison, near the best shopping and restaurants in mid-town.

title: Top notch
text:
The very best accommodations and service. The room was impeccable and they always exceeded expectations when it came to service. John Mark managed to get every dinner reservation we wanted including  three Michelin 3
Sar restaurants that were fully committed when I tried.

title: Elegant hotel
text:
We found Lowell Hotel by internet search. Wow - what a great, luxury boutique
hotel on the Upper East Side, tucked between Park and Madison avenues, two short blocks from Central Park.  The staff is top-notch and leave no stone unturned in ensuring its guests receive personal attention to all needs.  We've stayed in other 5-star hotels but the Lowell has set a new bar for intimate elegance.

title: My most recent stay.
text: Without question, the finest hotel in New York. From the moment of arrival to my bags being loaded for the return trip to the airport, the attentiveness and service was superb. Add the beauty of this wonderful boutique hotel along with it's unparalleled location, and you are guaranteed a wonderful experience. As an aside, I have literally planned trip dates to New York to coincide with the availability of rooms at The Lowell.

title: Love The Lowell
text: We come to NY every October for an 8 night stay.  We became acquainted with The Lowell, after the place we previously stayed was closed permanently by Covid. Suite 7E is perfect for us: plenty of storage; comfortable living area; working desk; lots of natural light; very sleep inducing bed; amazing bathroom. title: Luxury in New York.
text: Excellent hotel in New York City for furnishings and common areas. Central location on The Upper East Side. You turn The corner and you are on Madison Avenue with its boutique. We did not jave dinner in The hotel Restaurant, but friends reported it in enthusiastic reviews.

title: An island of calm
text: Loved every part of my stay.  Breakfast was great, and Anthony was fantastic and sufficiently gentle for first human contact of the day.  Reception was so on the ball.  I felt like a truly valued guest.  I will look forward to returning to my oasis of civility in Manhattan.

title: Wonderful stay
text:
We spent 4 nights in a Deluxe Junior Suite at the Lowell.  The room was "as advertised", with wood floors and a small terrace.  It is in a great location on E. 63rd just a couple of blocks from Central Park.

The staff was very good and friendly, and unlike some other recent trips, the housekeeping was done daily.

The room also has a small kitchen with a refrigerator and hotplate which came in very handy for leftovers!

Only complaint was that the room did not come with a coffee maker!  We requested a Nespresso machine (which they have on request), but they said they were out and would send up a percolator.  It never came. So we requested a Nespresso machine the next day and it was delivered (but it didn't work, so they sent another).

The room also included breakfast which was very good.

title: Beautiful Gem of a Hotel
text: We loved our stay there and they made you feel very special indeed.  Service was par excellence. Room was lovely and totally quiet, amazing considering it was in New York City. Bed was wonderful.  Bathroom was beautiful.  Great bed and quiet in the room made for great sleeping.

title: Perfect Weekend!
text: The Lowell Hotel is the ultimate boutique hotel.  From the second we arrived to the moment we were ready to depart the service was top notch.  Every employee we encountered treated us as we were the most important guests in the hotel.  At check-in we received an upgrade to the one bedroom suite on the 16th floor which included a full kitchenette with fridge, fireplace, large marble bathroom with soaking tub and walk in shower, amazing views of the neighborhood, and king size bed with two closets in the bedroom.  As other travelers have said, it was literally NYC apartment living.  Location is perfect to walk to midtown attractions, Central Park, and art museums.  We did not get an opportunity to have dinner at Majorelle, but enjoyed breakfast each morning which was included with our reservations.  Overall it was an amazing weekend and the key to a great vacation is where you stay, what experiences you take in, and where you eat.  The Lowell has the where you stay part, down to perfection.

There are other great hotels in NYC, but this is the jewel in the crown

And the clincher: 71 bucks for 2 boiled eggs, a juice and an espresso! WOW! 
For the Aspirational.

title: My Opinion

It’s the best hotel in town. Great staff. Stay makes you feel outstanding. Location top in the city. Beutiful bar and restaurant and a private living room type. 
Not much mor to say when you go and only experience the best.

title: Best Hotel in NYC
text: This is seriously the best hotel in NYC. I have stayed at most of the 5 star hotels in the city and the Lowell Hotel is outstanding. From the check in to the bell staff, no detail is missed. We were treated with a welcome bottle of wine. The room was spacious with excellent decor. We felt like we were at home. The room was quiet. The breakfast room was lovely and the food delicious. Didn't have a chance to try the restaurant but  we will the next time we are there. We will definitely be back. Amazing location.

title: We love Jacques Bar
text: We love Jacques Bar. The staff are exceptional. Hassan is always so incredibly attentive. Tony greets us with his charming friendliness. We feel truly special and welcome when we come here.  While we would love to keep it our little secret, we cannot. We keep bringing friends and family here and everyone loves it and cannot wait to go back.

title: May be the best Botique urban hotel in the world.
text: We travel extensively and have come to expect wonderful stays in small hotels around the world. None surpasses the Lowell. The rooms are beautiful, the people wonderful and attentive. Some of the suites have wood burning fireplaces and, on a cold snowy night in New York, a roaring fire and a perfect cocktail from the Majorelle bar is the perfect end to an evening.

title: best hotel in town
text: so happy i found this hotel, the location, the service, everything was perfect. the suite are very romantic, and it is a little bit of europe in NYC. i wish i have found this place earlier, because it is the kind of place which make your stay unique

title: Finally finding a gem in New York
text: I have heard whispers about The Lowell and now I know why. Guests do not want to share as it is outstanding in all categories and an oasis in NY and feels like you have transported to another world, country or your family's home.  Intimate, luxurious, personable and staffed by ultimate professionals in the art of hoteling.

title: I'd stay again but they need some improvements!
text:
only instant nescafe and coffee mate and one type of tea (earl grey) provided in the room.     coffee mate?  seriously?   you couldn't put some real cream or milk in your fridge?   nescafe?  I haven't drank instant since i was in college in 1980's.

overall a very nice hotel room was lovley old school if a bit small.   staff were excellent and great location if you have upper east side stuff to do....great shopping!

title: Anniversary celebration
text: My wife and I have wanted to stay at the Lowell for years.  We finally splurged and went this March to celebrate our anniversary.  I can offer no suggestion for improvement; honestly, it was one of the best hotel experiences we've ever had over many years of travel around the world:  as near to perfection as is possible.

title: A true Gem.
text: An oasis of elegance and refinement in the Upper Eastside. Friendly and impeccable service from arrival to departure. Small and club-like with a heart of gold. Professional and discreet staff and facilities make it difficult to leave. A peaceful haven.

title: Incredible Upper East Side Hotel!
text:
This was our third visit to the Lowell in the past twelve months, and it was like coming home.  We were welcomed as if we were family!  Eric, Emelie, and Louis at reception greeted us and made us feel they were truly happy to have us staying with them again.  Each staff member we met, from doormen, to bellmen, to housekeeping, went out of their way to make our stay memorable and enjoyable. 
 
We had a lovely junior suite on the 9th floor - spacious and beautifully decorated.  We enjoyed cocktails and a light dinner in Jacques Bar - taken care of by Hassan, the most charming host.

Altogether, a wonderful stay - just too short.  Can't wait to visit again soon.

title: The most COMFORTABLE hotel in NYC!
text: For someone who wants an Upper East Side pre-war apartment experience without the overall cost to purchase and maintain one, just book at the Lowell. This is like staying at your own place, fireplace, small full kitchen, spacious bedroom and bathroom, with all the amenities and then some! Everyone is friendly and willing to build you a fire at 1am or rush to help you with whatever you need. Yet they are also discreet so you don't feel "over serviced". I have yet to stay in a more comfortable environment in New York, yet am still exposed to all the 5 star amenities one expects at this type of establishment. I never want to leave!

title: Perfection
text: From reservations to arrival, through accommodations and dining, to departure, every step was smooth, pleasant and welcoming. Looking forward to next visit; it will be like seeing old friends again ….

title: A Celebratory Treat
text:
After the snakes and ladders game of International Travel during the Pandemic (mainly snakes, few ladders), it was both unexpected and magical to actually make it to New York to celebrate my wife's 60th birthday at Christmas.  

We'd eschewed the more well known and larger hotel offerings in favour of booking months in advance what appeared to be a more boutique and unique experience in the upper east side. We were not disappointed. This is a sublime building in a wonderful location and our one bedroom suite was fabulously appointed.  All of the staff were very friendly and helpful, especially the concierge John Mark.  

While covid restrictions limited some of the services available, we'll never forget a Christmas Eve evening sat in front of our log fire with a bottle of fizzy.

title: Classy, charming, boutique hotel.
text: My wife and I stayed for a three-day respite while the floors of our home in New Jersey were being refinished. The hotel exudes understated elegance and character on the Upper East side amidst the surrounding brownstones. The property is well located with a very attentive staff and offers all the essential amenities.

title: Luxury and Outstanding Service on the Upper East Side
text: A fantastic hotel in a fabulous location.  The staff is wonderful - friendly, professional, knowledgeable, kind and accommodating. We like staying near Central Park, and this location is perfect.  The Lowell lives up to its place as one of New York's top hotels.  Highly recommended.

title: Outstanding service
text: For us this is the best hotel in NYC. It is small, privately owned and comfortable, with exceptional service. Also conveniently situated o 63rd near Madison. Our travel plans had to change because of covid causing cancellation of a booked cruise, but the changes were handled by the hotel without fuss and very efficiently.

title: The Jewel on East 63rd Street
text: As always, service was top draw and the holiday décor was over the top, Staying at The Lowell is always a treat. All staff were professional and made us feel like we were staying at an elegant home rather than a hotel.

title: Above and Beyond Expectations
text: I had the privilege of staying at The Lowell Hotel for ten days over the Thanksgiving holiday, and from the moment I arrived at the hotel my experience was nothing short of amazing. Upon arrival, I was accommodated with a glass of wine while I waited for my room to be ready, during that time I was able to have a look around at the historical layout that is the Lowell. Every detail I came across was immaculate to the eye, when I finally made it to my room I was blown away at how upscale and beautiful everything was. Each staff member I came into contact with provided service that went above and beyond any expectations I had. They provide everything you want and assist you with anything you might need help with. This is a hotel you need to stay at while visiting New York City, it is comfortably located in the Upper East Side and is surprisingly very quiet. You are just a few blocks away from shops, Central Park, and amazing food. I HIGHLY recommend you stay at the Lowell for your home away from home while on vacation, or business trips.

title: Outstanding
text: Lovely rooms, excellent service and location. This is a first-rate luxury hotel, quiet and understated. We were unable to use the beautiful public rooms given our hesitation in the midst of the omicron surge but would be very eager to return when the pandemic calms down. That said, we felt very safe given the health practices the hotel employed.

title: Lovely Hotel
text: This is my second time staying at the Lowell. The service is impeccable form the minute you arrive. The doorman and the front desk are very welcoming. The library is a lovely place to enjoy tea or coffee. Our favorite getaway spot in NYC. We will be back!

title: Awesome!
text: Excellent hotel and staff. You can't go wrong with The Lowell.  Great location, and surprisingly quiet in the middle of the UES. The breakfast in the Pembroke Room is not to be missed. The best coffee in Manhattan.

title: Absolutely beautiful hotel and incredible staff.
text: We can't rave enough about this lovely gem of a French hotel.  Absolutely beautiful with abundant florals, quaint spaces to relax, charming ambience and wonderful service. We were in and out of Jacques, the bar/lounge quite a few times and it had exceptional service, food, cocktails and a very popular place with locals which says a lot! The entire staff is just amazing, from the front desk, concierge and bell service to the restaurant and bar.  This staff knows how to take care of its guests and make them feel special and welcome. Our room was beautiful and spacious and had everything we needed from a hotel of this standard. Location, location, location as Central Park is two blocks away as well as Park and Madison Avenues.  We walked the Christmas windows on 5th easily from the Lowell and there are lots of little streets with good restaurants and little shops nearby.  My husband and I can't wait to return!

title: Excellent - 5 Stars
text: From the moment you arrive at the front desk the level of service is impeccable. Eric and Louis at the front desk are helpful and always professional. Jean Marc the Conceirge is well versed, efficient and accommodating. Bellhops are always ready to cater to any need. I have stayed over 20 times at this hotel and the level of service is always consistently excellent. The restaurant and bar are unrivaled to other hotels. You feel more like you are a guest in someone’s townhouse than in a hotel. Majorelle is one of the best restaurants in NYC. I debated for selfish reasons not to write a review. This place is that good and I wanted to keep it all to myself.

title: A wondeful holiday stay
text: Our family had a wondeful visit at the The Lowell.  You could feel the holiday spirit in the air.  The experience felt just like a Christmas New York holiday.  Thank you for the wondeful memories, and we can't wait to come back again next year.

title: Family trip
text:
We have stayed at the Lowell for many years and this visit was at the level of quality that we have always known. Good rooms, good food, good service!

You make it feel as a family affair!

The employees care very much for the guests.

BG

title: Wonderful Hotel and Staff
text: The Lowell excels on so many levels.  The hotel itself is beautiful.  It's in a great location.  The rooms are spacious and comfortable, but more than anything it's the staff that make it special.  Each member knows your name, and greets you so warmly that you feel like family.  We look forward to returning.

title: Perfection
text: From the time you enter to the time you leave, you are greeted like family. It is not just the usual efficiency, but a much more personal approach. The Lowell quite simply becomes a second home after your first visit.

title: Wonderful NYC Retreat
text: This Hotel is a gem on the upper east side of NYC. Everyone from the doormen to the front desk to room service is kind, pleasant, and attentive. The rooms are cozy, lovely, and peaceful. The food is truly delicious, which is surprising for a hotel. It's pricey, but I recommend The Lowell if you are looking for a beautiful retreat and luxury in a lovely part of town.

title: Luxury weekend at the Lowell
text: The Lowell has become my favorite hotel in NYC.  The service, rooms and amenitites are exceptional!  It transcribes you into relaxation and luxury from the minute you step inside.  We love the rooms, restauarnt and lounge for the guests.  The dining room for breakfast is exquisite as well as the food and the team serving you.  Our room this time had a balcony where we enjoyed our morning coffee and heard church bells on Sunday!  Thank you for a wonderful visit to see our daughter!

title: Best of the Best
text: Everything about The Lowell is top notch: the location, the building, the rooms, the people, the breakfast restaurant, and the services.  Perfection!  We are about to make our reservations for October 2022.

title: Our Lowell Hotel Disappointment.
text:
An unpleasant experience.  

Physically, the ambience is cramped. 
We had requested, through Amex Platinum Travel, far in advance, a junior suite on the highest floor possible.  Nevertheless, upon arrival, tired from a long flight, we were immediately hustled to a grim room unworthy of Rikers.  No visible sky, windows facing only claustrophobic walls.  Horrible.  We politely let the front desk know how upset and disappointed we felt. We had heard nice things about the Lowell and had been looking forward to our stay.  

Naturally, we spent more money for a euphemistically called “classic suite”, still barely acceptable accommodations. A guest relations person graciously offered to send us a fruit basket, which, alas, after our 3 night stay, never arrived.  Despite assurances that she would “look after us” and be “available,” we never saw her again.

The checkout experience with Eric at the front desk, was reminiscent of a strict boarding school:  Barbara and I were treated to a chastising , threatening lecture on how to treat front desk staff!  Ironically, 2 hotel workers confidentially volunteered to us that THEY had difficulties getting along with certain front desk staff!  However, the maids, waiters, etc were very competent and nice.

Finally, and I hope you’re reading this, Amex Platinum:  front desk clerk Eric concluded his lecture by advising us to first contact the Lowell directly in the future to secure our room preferences, as their regular guests do.  Does this not suggest  an end run around Amex Platinum? And that reserving through Amex Platinum directly guarantees only the dregs?

title: Back after two years and happy to be there!
text: We have made this hotel our "go to" spot for several years. While it is uber expensive, getting the bill at the end of the trip never quite feels like you've been zinged. The furnishings are exquisite, the staff is super friendly and professional, and the location is great. The hotel was re-emerging from lockdown when we visited in late June, and did not have all of the amenities available. We ordered food from the restaurant next door and the bell staff brought it to us, but we were happy with the limited offerings.  The hotel accommodated our friends joining us in the library, and we had drinks in a very quiet setting, which is fantastic. I would bypass the concierge for dining  - we've had repeated disappointments that were never addressed, and I've generally fared better by doing my own research for reservations and restaurant ratings. Overall, the hotel has not lost it's sparkle and we still love it.

title: OUTSTANDING
text: This was our first visit at this wonderful hotel. The staff was excellent from the doorman to housekeeping all are exceptional. We had a one bedroom suite on the fifteenth floor. The bathroom was all marble with a heated floor, the bed was great. The Lowell is now my choice when in New York.

title: Exceptional and Consistent!
text: I just left The Lowell Hotel after spending Labor Day Weekend and words cannot express what a quality hotel it is!  Between the staff and the room I highly recommend this hotel.  Patrick is the front desk manager and an asset to the hotel, along with the other staff who accommodate every request with a smile!  Whether traveling for pleasure or business (post Pandemic soon) this hotel is #1 in NYC.

title: Quick trip....look forward to the next!
text: We had one night in the city and hadn’t stayed at the Lowell before. The check in was warm and welcoming when we got there.  Explaining which restaurants close by were open, how we could get breakfast in the morning, etc. The room itself was gorgeous and well appointed and bed super comfy. There was a nice bonus of two free mini bar choices since they decided not to leave a welcome gift of food because of COVID. The only thing I would have changed: there was an option on the TV to donate cash to the hotel (assuming it was for the hard times caused by the pandemic). If it was an adoption to donate $ that went directly to the employees, I would have donated in a heartbeat!

title: Beautiful
text: Great and stunning ambience , great cocktail menu , had the spaghetti in tomorrow sauce , such a simple dish and so well done. Classy and élégant with an intimate ambience and I will definitely be back

title: Oh how I wanted to love you!
text:
I stayed here for 4 nights. While the public rooms were beautiful my room was somewhat dated. (I got rid of my hunt prints years ago.) But spacious and comfortable. I would ask for one of the updated rooms.
  I had breakfast daily, once in the  dining room as well as room service when I came down with the flu. Breakfast in the dining room is lovely, impeccable service on beautiful china.  Unfortunately the food.... not horrible but not up to this beautiful hotel. Toast and a bagel on different days, burnt.  French toast?, please, my grandchildren make better. Its not supposed to be dry bread in the middle.  Again, impeccable service, beautiful surroundings but just not well prepared food.
  Doormen. Hmmm. One of them was great, always with smile.....but others?  Its always your first and last impression of a hotel.  Rarely would they open both doors for you or even offer to get you a cab. At times they were on the house phone and you were an afterthought. When I left the doorman asked if he could get a cab to the airport for me. Great, I was struggling with my luggage, already out front.  No cab. Finally a cab drops off  a couple, I go over to ask if he could take me to the airport. The doorman finally comes back (where did he go?) and loads the suitcases I took over to the cab myself. Not the service expected.   
  Beautiful property, either fantastic service  or  a disappointment. Oh how I wanted to love you.....

title: They don’t miss a beat !!
text:
Wow. What an incredible experience. Very similar to the feeling of staying in a boutique hotel in Paris. Their attention to detail, quality of food and drinks and level of customer service was impressive and refreshing. Room was large, immaculate and so comfortable. Location perfect - close to everything I needed. 
Not cheap - in fact more expensive than I thought but.... overall worth it.

title: THE BEST 25TH ANNIVERSARY EVER!!!
text: How do I say thank you to the Lowell Hotel and all those wonderful people who work there!  To Paul, the director of reservations, who had white roses, champagne and chocolate covered strawberries waiting in our suite, we cannot thank you enough.  We stayed in the Garden Suite, which was stunning with a wood burning fireplace, kept stocked by the helpful Armand, who saw to everything we needed, and two outdoor terraces.  The suite was way beyond our expectations and felt more like the pied de terre of a fabulously rich interior designer than a hotel room.  Thank you also to Christina and Anthony at the front desk who greeted us so warmly.  My husband and I had the best 25th anniversary at the Lowell and we can't wait to return!! For anyone celebrating a special occasion, this truly is the only place to stay!

title: Old Scholl classic with a lot of Class
text: I will definitely be coming back to this hotel on my visits to NYC. It is a classic old school NYC hotel, with impeccable service, beautiful old suites with some having wild burning fireplaces. Fantastic location, but units not inexpensive so be prepared to pay but it is well worth it in my opinion. Enjoy it and have fun there it has a great. Bar and the Gym is being re-done because it is in need of it. It is th one thing that they needed to fix but they are my only hope is that I can still get in, as it is in my opinion one of the best in the city.

title: Amazing place
text:
Didnt expect to have such nice and amazing customer service experience , the staff are friendly,  beds are comfortable and suite was amazing,  location is superb, you feel like home to be honest I would definitely come back next time and stay longer.
Highly recommended

title: Lovely Lowell still a Great Option in NY
text: Stayed here again with family for a week of shows and opera. It's still very good, though not among the best in the world I've stayed at (none are in NY, why is that?). This feels like a luxury apartment building with good service and food. The staff try very hard to satisfy and impress and it mostly hits the mark. Upgraded to large and cozy one bedroom suite 16A that's elegantly decorated in an understated way (the lobby and public rooms are glitzier and seem more luxurious than the actual rooms). The redesigned bathroom was beautiful with white marble, the best lighting I've ever experienced in a hotel bathroom, and heated floors but why not two sinks in a suite? Majorelle is very good in a stunning setting but be prepared for super-traditional, heavy French. Breakfasts are disappointing and exceedingly expensive for what you get (why are all breakfasts $200 for 2 in NY? It's outrageous). My one major complaint was an exceedingly noisy mini-fridge in the room which churned loudly intermittently at night. I complained but it was never fixed. When I video'ed the noise and presented, they took care of many items on my bill, which was classy. The personnel are all very nice. This is a discreet, old-school NY luxury. It still has quirks that keep it from five stars. I've yet to find the perfect hotel in New York.

title: Wonderful experience with Miriam for tea!
text: I visited the Lowell with sister for my mothers 60th birthday tea in the Pembroke Room. Our server, Miriam, was wonderful and made sure the experience was extra special. I highly recommend for a holiday treat!

title: Wonderful Service at the Pembroke Tea Room
text: A couple of girlfriends and I went to the Pembroke Tea Room for a Christmas tea. We had the most WONDERFUL service. Our server Mariem was incredibly kind and attentive. Thank you for a lovely afternoon.

title: Pembroke Room- ask for Mariem!
text: Had a lovely tea service for the holidays and Mariem provided such incredible service- we ended up staying much longer than we meant and ordering another bottle of bubbles because she made us so comfortable! Perfect new holiday tradition.

title: Pleasure
text: Wonderful hotel . Very professional and  helpful staff. A big shout out to Mariam at breakfast. She was so friendly and provided wonderful service. She is a keeper and an awesome addition to the breakfast staff. What a great breakfast!! Thank you and hope to get back soon.

title: Understated elegance, subtle and attentive
text: I like every aspect of this hotel with to exceptions: first, the superabundance of flowers and floral displays remind me of a funeral parlor rather than a conservatory which I think they were aiming for. Secondly, while attentive to every detail, there are one or two underlings on staff who seem officious, mores than they should be where discretion is the true value of Loell's staff. One of the finest hotel managers I have ever met is named David and he sorts everything out toute suite. He is very professional, but kind and congenial as well:

title: Why I Love The Lowell Hotel, New York City
text:
Located in the Upper East Side, not far from Central Park, on a quiet tree lined street, the Lowell is the number one hotel in NYC for many reasons.  I have stayed here on ten occasions and have never been disappointed and this is why. 
- elegantly designed pristine guest rooms
- extremely helpful concierges (getting Broadway       tickets, making restaurant reservations, even arranging a doctor’s visit for me) 
- warm, friendly, professional staff (from the doorman to the front desk)
- delicious food at both restaurants
- lovely bar area and library
- ample gym facility
- great location for shopping along Madison, Fifth,   Park, and Lexington Avenues
               Can’t wait for my next visit!

title: Can’t be bothered to return a call.
text: We typically stay at the Surrey, but decided to try something new. Called the Lowell to inquire about a reservation and got a recording. Left a detailed message. Never got a return call. That is the first indication not to stay.

title: Albergo carino nell upper east side
text:
L albergo è sicuramente un hotel di lusso ma sinceramente ha bisogno di una “svecchiata” se mi si passa L aggettivo.
L area dove si fa colazione va sicuramente rinnovata. Il bar al piano terra è molto bello ed i cocktail sono di qualità, barman preparato. Ho avuto la fortuna di trovare una camera rinnovata (quindi penso ci stiano già mettendo mano) ed infatti era spettacolare. Curata, pulita ed ampia. 
L altra coppia che viaggiava con me non ha avuto altrettanta fortuna. Quindi occhio...
Nel complesso buon hotel ma può essere molto meglio.

title: Delusione
text:
Hotel di altri tempi che necessita di una profonda e totale ristrutturazione.
Camere vecchie pagate a peso d’oro giustificato parzialmente solo dalla location in upper east side.
Personale gentile, ma non riesce a controbilanciare la struttura vecchia.
Allo stesso prezzo, anche a meno, c’è di molto meglio e più nuovo.

title: Luxury and impeccable service
text:
Another nyc hotel review. 
Loved the Lowell. 
This is elegant but refined. 
Enjoyed a long weekend in the Astor Suite and felt right at home. 
Staff were marvelous, my accommodation beautiful and the breakfast room luxurious. 
All in all, the best hotel I’ve been in NYC.

title: Great one
text: It was the last min decision to visit manhattan, and we need a two-room suite, in this area. It was our first time in The Lowell and we. Enjoy very much the stay. The only a comment is regarding rooms  maintenance, some of the items are old and not in good condition.

title: careless front desk/mngmt staff
text: we were exited to stay at the lowell for the first time stayed at the lowell a couple weeks past.... the room given to us was very cozy and cute, beware that many of the rooms are facing  a brick wall and feel dark.... besides that, we had a constant urine smell in our room.... we think it was from years of use the marble soaked it in... imagine the subway bathroom smell in your luxury hotel room.... front desk did not care at all! we kept complaining and nothing was done.... this place needs renovations dont be fooled!... front desk is not there to help and is not friendly.... we wanted to have some of the charges taken off for the foul subway urine smell but they could care less.... we asked them to have the Director of Operation contact us back via email... we never got a respond... marie at the front desk is very careless about guest situations it seems... sadly we will not stay there again and choose a different hotel as there are many choices...

title: Lovely Breakfast
text: We enjoyed a lovely breakfast this morning in the Pembroke Room.  It's not all that often that we treat ourselves, but I really enjoyed taking my sister to the Lowell this morning.  We had a delightful table by the window, but it was our waiter who made the experience so memorable.  He was incredibly attentive and despite there being other people int he room, we felt special.  Thank you!

title: Lovely hotel, amazing service!
text: I thought the service at this hotel was amazing.   I did not care for the first room we were assigned.   It was very small and claustrophobic on the 17th floor.  This is an expensive hotel.   The front desk was amazing in light of the fact that I was not happy.  We spent the night there and they moved us the following day to the 9th floor.  The room was perfect.  The bathroom was lovely.  The bar was so much fun ...we loved hanging out there.  The hotel is conveniently located on the East Side.  Breakfast was very good.

title: This hotel is just not for me
text:
After staying at another hotel for many years and having a few problems, it was recommended to us that we stay at the Lowell. My wife was the primary guest, but I also was there most of the time. After quite a few stays, we decided that this just was  not the hotel for us. There were just too many issues. Originally, I did not plan to do a trip advisor review as it would not be a good one and most all reviews are positive. But when the sales manager wrote to my wife wanting to know why we cancelled all of our remaining reservations for 2019, and we received absolutely no reply, I felt that they really did not care ,and I would go ahead with the review. I will say that the people were very nice as expected, especially the bell staff, breakfast dining room staff and doormen. All of these complaints were for the same room on different stays.

Here are some edited excerpts from the email to the sales manager on reasons we decided to not return These are edited as the email was to and from my wife, so the tense is basically changed with a few changes in wording.

The bathroom did not have double sinks. When both of us were guests, this is an inconvenience. We had trouble with the sink having very little water coming out. We complained but it wasn’t until after writing directly to GM, and saying that I thought it needed a new aerator was it finally fixed. The shower had the cartridge replaced as it too did not have good pressure. In a hotel of your caliber, these are things that should be checked before a guest arrives, and not fixed upon a complaint after several days.

I was never able to get the heat working properly even after complaining several times. It never worked right.

On my last visit, my wife’s clothes got locked in a closet when the door knob was just turning. I was able to mess with it and put her clothes in the other closet until it was fixed. 

Also, we were never happy climbing into the bed. My wife is short, and the bed was very high. The living room furniture was not comfortable, so we constantly had to move from couch to chair to the bedroom. And at times, the room would get a smoky smell from the fireplace. 

On the last visit, they were painting the stairways, and the door was open letting the smell seep into the hallway and into our room. My wife called down to have them close the door, and when it was not done, I went and untied the cord.  My wife is very allergic, and made everyone aware of this saying she didn’t want maids who wear perfume to clean the room. This was followed in most cases, but not always.

All in all, I think we prefer a hotel that is more contemporary, with larger rooms.

title: Wonderful Hotel
text: This was my 2nd visit to the Lowell hotel and it just gets better and better! Being a very experienced traveler I personally rate this hotel one of my favorites of all time!! The staff is so kind and thoughtful to anticipate your needs! Looking forward to my return
