title: Took our friends to NYC for their first visit.
text: Beautiful Upper East Side stay.  Great location, beautiful rooms, staff that went above and beyond. A darling birthday cake awaited us in our rooms, plus fruit, wine and a personal note welcoming us to The Lowell.

title: Great Small Luxurious Hotel
text:
Everyone here greets you and is genuine and very helpful.  The location is perfect.  
The rooms are tiny or ours was #7C  We had two twin beds and a bathroom with one sink.  No room for luggage storage but they were very helpful and took our luggage and stored it.  
The breakfast was set in the most pleasant room and was perfection.  The wait staff were very attentive and there was lots of hot coffee.  
The hotel is located on 63rd Street just off the corner of Madison, and given the location it was very quiet outside.
Our air conditioner re-set all night, this would need to be adjusted first before another stay.  
The were most helpful -- that is what stands out at this hotel is the service.

title: New York's Finest
text: The Lowell always creates the most beautiful memories because the Hotel is such a gem. Every aspect of the Lowell is perfection.  I love the size of the hotel because it is so cozy and romantic.  Every person who works there is kind and very professional.

title: Recent Stay to Celebrate a Birthday
text: Location, service, room accommodations, staff friendliness and professionalism, food, ambiance all receive high marks.  We adore the hotel.  Just perfect. We spent the weekend to celebrate my wife's birthday.  We hosted friends for drinks before dinner at Jacques; had lunch at Majorelle and received in-room massages. Working with the hotel to plan flower arrangements and services was incredibly low-stress.

title: The best staff
text: The Lowell represents everything that the Upper East Side is....elegant, service-oriented, sophisticated.  All the staff members are friendly, helpful and courteous. Shout out to Marie Petin who checked in pre-arrival to make sure we were set-up to our individual liking, and then made sure all was well throughout and at check-out.  Hotel is not the most modern but very clean and elegant.

title: Wow
text: My husband and I went to the law for my birthday weekend. It is the most beautiful hotel I have ever stayed in. And I’ve stayed in a lot of hotels. The service was impeccable the food was delicious and there is nothing I would improve upon

title: Wonderful stay
text: Wonderful stay in Manhattan. The Lowell hotel has a perfect location, close to everything. The service was excellent, cosy rooms with fireplace and really nice and fresh bathrooms. The bar and restaurants had really good atmosphere. Our best stay in NYC.

title: So close but yet so far
text:
It all started out fine. I arrived on a Friday evening. I checked in to a lovely suite, put down my things, and went to dinner. 

I’ve been trying Mid-town hotels since the Four Seasons 57th Street changes its bar and put Beanie Babies all over the lobby - a Bridge too far. I even talked to the manager. I tried the Pierre. Never again. Then I saw a list that rated the Lowell No. 1 in Manhattan. The list had a downtown hotel I like very much in the top 10. So I figured it was trustworthy. And New York friends confirmed that view. 

And that first night I thought I had found my Mix-town home. The first two days I had late breakfast in my room and found they do real butter croissants, the kind that are so light they flake apart at the touch. Awesome. I finally got to the breakfast room on Monday, and there, too, the food and service were great. That Monday an odd coincidence occurred. At a table close to me a rating reviewer who had stayed over the weekend was meeting with the two top managers. Having once owned a four diamond AAA hotel, I recognized the lingo. Mostly she was positive but there were a few hiccups in service here and there. 

It was on Tuesday things started going a bit off the rails. First, I had asked for the housekeepers to leave my toiletries as I arranged them on the bathroom counter and not to put little towels under them. Over the weekend and through Monday, all was well. On Tuesday the little towels appeared. I said something. No towels in the evening, but back they were on Wednesday. A minor thing, hardly the end of the world given the state of the world. 

But then there was the laundry bag problem. I had come from another city so I arrived with both laundry and dry cleaning to do. Fine. All went well. But the laundry bags and forms were never replaced. Tuesday morning I asked for some to be put in my room that day. At 11:30 that night, tired and just wanting to put out some laundry and find laundry I had sent that day and wanted for the next day that had not been returned, I called the desk. Fifteen minutes later the laundry arrived. Then came laundry bags but no forms. Exhausted with a fairly early morning ahead of me, I gave up. In the morning the forms were there, slid under the door. So, OK, housekeeping is erratic. 

Meanwhile I had had a lovely dinner with a friend at Marjorelle, the hotel’s restaurant. Excellent service. Great food. A short but rich wine list. Lovely. 

Then came the checkout. I had breakfast with a friend, also lovely. I had two hours to pack, plenty of time. I finished with 15 minutes to spare and, just as I was about to call for the bellman, the woman on the front desk called to ask when I was leaving. Great timing. She said she’d send the bellman. I waited. 10 minutes. I called the desk. A matter of minutes, she said. I waited five. Getting concerned because it was now past my time set to leave for JFK, I took the luggage, one large bag, a toiletries bag, book bag and purse for the plane, down myself. 

In the lobby, there was no one to help me. I had several FedExes to be sent and dropped them at the desk with a gratuity for the service. I then took my luggage to the front door where I asked the bellman if he could help - you gave to go up several stairs to get out of the hotel. He said, I have to help someone check in. I said: Do you help people checking out?? I know; I was getting snarky. Bad. I rolled and bumped my book bag and purse up the stairs and out. The bellman then did get my large bag. With the help of my driver, we got it all in the car.

I know I am fortunate. I can afford to stay at the Lowell and have a driver take me to the airport. I am thankful. But, it seems to me that these breaches in service aren’t quite what I am paying for. I might try the hotel again. It is lovely, cozy, discreet, and walking distance to the places I need to go in Mid-town. Other than that last bellman, the staff was uniformly friendly and helpful. But, the exit left a bad feeling. We’ll see.

title: Need a 24 hour doorman
text:
I was surprised that the Lowell did not have a doorman on premises 24 hours.  In my view you cannot be a first class hotel in a major city without a 24 hour doorman.

Hotels are separated by their level of service.  While the service here was acceptable, it fell short of world class

title: great stay
text: very nice small hotel on upper east side; service/staff was excellent; room was very nice but a view of office building; strange that you pay extra for a fireplace and then they charge to have a fire; still a great stay and we will return on our next visit

title: outstanding luxury and comfort
text: Words alone do not describe the level of luxury, comfort and professionalism encountered at the Lowell Hotel. Within the hustle and bustle of NYC, the Lowell offers an elegant, peaceful and restful 'home away from home'. Recommended highly and without reservation.

title: A World Apart
text: If there is one difficult aspect about The Lowell, it is that given what a beautiful, warm and inviting hotel it continues to be, it is hard to leave it for just a few hours to participate in the activities you have scheduled during your visit to New York City.

title: Afternoon tea - excellent
text:
Visited March 2019 for afternoon tea. Location close to Central park on E63rd. Tea lounge had good atmosphere. Both waiters efficient and knowledgeable. Speciality tea, sandwiches, and scones all excellent.

Very pleasant experience, would like to stay at hotel one day.

title: Excellent stay
text: Wonderful service, amazing attention to detail, great food. This was truly a perfect stay. The staff were incredible accommodating. Rare to find this level of service. Great location, quiet neighborhood close to many wonderful activities.

title: Afternoon Tea
text:
Afternoon tea at the Lowell is rated # 1 in NYC which is true!
Serene setting, gracious service, excellent selection of teas and wonderful food. 
Mr. Mohammed (waiter) knowledgeable regarding tea selection. No rush, Mr. Mohammed (excellent service).

title: One of the best in New York
text: This hotel is classic.  I've stayed here 4 or 5 times.  It's in a very busy area, near the park, but jussst far enough away that it feels quiet.  They just redid both of their restaurants, the second I think is a "tea room" and I always respect an old fashioned hotel that's willing to keep up with the times.  There's a fine line between traditional and archaic, and the Lowell feels like old school New York vibes with nuanced attention to the current times.  The rooms are really nice, especially the suites(duh but like REALLY nice.)  Narcisso and Jean Marc, the concierges, are great guys and easy to deal with/communicate with.  Sometimes at fancy hotels I feel ashamed asking the concierges questions and have to give myself a 10 minute peptalk to feel important enough to get my way lol.  Not the case at the Lowell. You'll feel welcomed.  It's the type of hotel where super wealthy people will stay for a couple months, cuz it simply feels like home.

title: Once again a flawless stay
text:
It was our fourth stay at this hotel and it's becoming a tradition for us. Raid your bank account and upgrade to a deluxe junior suite. We were upgraded to a 1-bedroom on our last visit, and it reminded me a bit of the Carlyle's suites. It was enormous, with a super comfy, yet sophisticated vibe, dark chevron wood flooring, luxurious fabrics and sturdy, repro furniture. It also has a minute galley "kitchen", and lots of closets, making it feel more like an apartment than a hotel room. 
We entertained friends one night in the living area, and staff lit our wood burning fireplace (not very eco friendly of us, but hey, we were on vacation).  While the bathroom's brass fixtures felt a bit Gordon Gekko-ish, it was still comfortable. The bed is uber supportive, in a good way, and once again we enjoyed every single meal we ordered from room service.
Most of the staff seemingly pride themselves on making guests feel as if they're coming back to a cosseting residence; cheerful greeting upon check-in, a bartender that remembers your cocktail of choice, and the bell staff welcomes you back as he cheerfully grabs the door for you. Housekeeping is flawless. The folks who work here seem to love their town and want you to love it too. It's fabulous. The hotel has few peers in NYC. They deserve flowery reviews.

title: The Pembrook Room - Afternoon Tea - Amazing experience
text:
love The Lowell hotel, beautiful interior, holiday decor, chic, cozy atmosphere, amazing customer service! I had a wonderful Afternoon Tea experience celebrating my birthday with my daughters. My favorite hotel and the tea room so far. (We visit NYC tea rooms at least once a month and this by far has been one of the best overall experiences)
  I also had an inquiry at the front desk about one of the coffe tables and the operations director reached out to me next day. Wow!

title: Exquisite hotel
text: We have been to the hotel several times, for tea lunch and also to the bar. The first thing guests encounter is  a delightfully perfumed lobby. There is a lovely tea room on the second floor and a small intimate bar next to the lobby. Serving drinks and small plates. The attention to detail is perfect . This hotel is a respite from the busy streets of nyc

title: Wonderful tea
text: We have night tea here every year. It is fabulous. Well worth the cost. Excellent service and food. Wonderful location. At Christmas time, the decorations are beautiful. We have tried many places for tea in NYC. This is the best.

title: Quiet elegance
text: This is a wonderful, discerning, quiet oasis in the upper East side.  It is like a  step back into a time when class, elegance and service was at it's finest. It is a carefully curated and pays attention to every detail to enhance the experience.   The staff is friendly and gracious and ready to fulfill your every whim. I feel like royalty when I stay there.

title: Low key luxury
text: Just returned from a two night stay. Hadn’t stayed here in 10 years and the property has benefited from upgraded restaurants etc. It still has the same low key graciousness and luxury and of course a different experience from The Carlyle and bigger NY hotels. Nice touch is the welcome drink. Front desk, housekeeping and restaurant staff are all friendly and efficient. Some extra charges did pop up but the front desk was very courteous about removing them.

title: Overpriced dated & under delivers
text: We brought our whole family here for thanksgiving, after touring a room on a prior visit, we fell in love and chose the hotel for our next stay. The room was NOTHING like we saw, despite paying for a suite and upwards of 26k. Room was dated, needing an upgrade in a big way. Fireplace was great, however they charged a fortune per log and it was hit and miss if anybody would actually show up to build it. (They required Lowell staff to build) service was C at best too many things to mention here. We thought we were in an episode of punked or candid camera there were so many things. We enjoyed our family time and made great memories despite a hotel that under delivered. If you’re desiring 5 star rooms and service, there are better choices in the same neighborhood.

title: A haven in New York
text: My wife and I visited New York for an important Birthday. She chose the Hotel and could not have made a better choice. The staff and management provide an attention to service and detail which could not be bettered. They made us feel like family guests. In addition to all this the Hotel is excellently situated for Museum visits and shopping

title: Cute Hotel In Quiet Part of Town
text: This hotel is very quaint with many small details like a beautiful breakfast and tea room and a cozy guest lounge. The cozy can lean toward stuffy occasionally. The rooms are a little tired, and I’m not sure the decor ever really worked for the vibe they want. Also, they aren’t going to go overboard to make you feel special or to meet your needs if they don’t know you. They definitely cater to the higher-end crowd. If you already know how things work, you’ll have a great time, but do your homework if you’ve never been to this hotel and you want to stay on the upper east side. Ultimately, we recommend this hotel for the location and the quiet retreat that it is. Just don’t mistake it for the Ritz.

title: Attention to detail makes a hotel
text: The Lowell has service that is superior. In addition the rooms are impeccably designed to offer luxury with comfort. Personally I love the small details that Lowell incorporates into the service and ambience. Not to mention a wonderful bed that provides an excellent nights sleep. I am grateful to have discovered this gem of a hotel.

title: Elegant Urban Oasis with Impeccable Personal Service
text:
I recently had the opportunity to stay at the Lowell for one night and I have to say I had a really great experience. I only wish I'd have had more time to enjoy this wonderful property. 

The Lowell was recently refurbished by renowned designer Michael Smith and the thoughtful updates really show. I work professionally with Michael often and many of his signature design cues seem to have imbued the Lowell  with a real sense of comfort and intimacy. It's like being in someone's elegant Upper East Side townhouse  rather than a hotel. 

Check-in was a breeze and very personal. I was offered Amex Fine Hotels & Resorts benefits even though I had booked my room through hotel tonight. That was very nice as I received complementary breakfast and a credit to use in the hotel. I was also offered a glass of champagne (although it never arrived). I did however receive a complementary bottle of mineral water and bowl of fruit delivered to my room shortly after arrival. 

The room was very comfortable and afforded all luxuries one expects in a 5 star hotel. The bathroom was very large with a huge shower and tub and plenty of fluffy towels and toiletries. The one small complaint I have is although the washstand looks beautiful it doesn't provide a lot of counter top space. Also, while running the hot water in the sink for more than 30 seconds the sink would make a terrible sound. I tried it a few times and it wouldn't stop, sounded like a booster pump or something running. Otherwise, my room experience was excellent. 

The breakfast in the Pembroke room was also lovely and service extremely professional. I really appreciated the complementary breakfast. They provided very nice Wilkin & Sons jams and jellies on the table, which is always a nice touch. The coffee could have been a bit better, but otherwise I had great experience before departure. 

I only wish I would have had more time to enjoy the lovely public rooms on the first floor and to dine in the beautiful Majorelle restaurant or have a drink in the chic Jacques bar.

title: Scammed by the Lowell Hotel
text: Upon check-in at the Lowell Hotel in September, 2018, I was told there would be no hot water from 10:00 p.m. that day to 5:00 a.m. the following day. I was also handed a paper with the same "no hot water" notice. Needless to say this is not what one expects from a five star hotel. Had I received the courtesy of advance notice I would have made alternative hotel plans. I declined to stay at the Lowell Hotel, but they have charged me for the night. How can the Lowell Hotel charge a guest for a night she didn't spend in one of their rooms for the reason that there was NO HOT WATER??!! Total scam job by a hotel not deserving of a five star rating!

title: Homely Civilised living in the best location New York
text: Great hotel with intimate personalised service situated in the best New York address.  An excellent breakfast and fine dining restaurants are capped off with comfortable roomy accommodation and knowledgeable and attentive friendly staff .

title: Tiny gem
text:
We adore the blocks of the Upper East Side that aren’t crowded. While this one is a bit crowded the minute you step into the Lowell you do not feel the crowd. The front desk staff was pleasant, our baggage brought right up. The elevator moves at glacial speed , maybe it’s intentional.
Rooms small, But had a balcony. Everything in order,  if not grand. Will definitly go again as bar is quiet and secluded and had previously stayed at Mark, but bar and lobby became impossible to navigate.
Plus there is Charles, what more could one want?

title: Classic Upper East Side Luxury Hotel
text:
We recently spent 4 nights at the Lowell. Let’s start by saying this is an expensive venue, even by NYC standards. We occupied a “junior suite” which is relatively generous in size, about 600 square feet. It cost over $1400 a night, not counting the usual taxes, etc. Our room included a generously proportioned sitting area, and a large mini bar that included plates and cutlery should we have wanted to eat in the room. The bed was comfortable but not the most comfortable hotel bed we have ever experienced. The decor was lovely, although I think it showed some signs of wear and there were subtle stains in a couple of locations on the carpet. The marble bathroom was large, included a tub and separate walk in shower. We were in a corner location on the 8th floor with windows on 2 sides, both facing other buildings across a narrow alley. No view, for sure.
Having looked at the online photos of other more expensive rooms in the hotel, I think I can safely say that we occupied a room that has not been recently renovated. That is not to say that it was not comfortable and very tasteful, because it was.
During our stay, we had several breakfasts in the small Pembroke Room on the second floor. The room is very genteel and a little on the fussy side. This is not a place for millenials. However, the food was beautifully prepared and served, albeit at a price.
We also ate in what is essentially a clubby library and at the bar, both lovely rooms and a quiet oasis in NYC. Cocktails were excellent, even at $21 a pop. 
One can not fail to mention the housekeeping at this hotel, which is superb. They are fastidious, quiet and always appear when you have vacated the room. The doorman John deserves particular mention for his friendly and engaging manner.
This is not the first time we have stayed at the Lowell, and it is an excellent choice on the UES. It needs a few touch-ups here and there, but it is extremely comfortable and well located, and if it is in your budget, you will not be disappointed.

title: Elegant cozy hotel
text:
Great location, full of flowers, delicious smell! 
It a small and cozy, it is a little heaven in the middle of NY chaos. 
The suites are perfect! 
The normal room is ok with refurbished bathrooms but I wouldn’t exactly call them “room with a view”
The two bars are lovely and cozy for an afternoon drink.

The breakfast was also delicious.

title: Birthday Fun!
text: Stayed here with 7 friends to celebrate a birthday. The location is great, delicious food, comfortable lounge areas and the best service from their professional employees. It was a wonderful experience!

title: Lovely Hotel!
text: What a beautiful hotel! The staff was very friendly. The room was comfortable. The food was delicious! My daughter and I attended a wedding shower at the restaurant in the hotel and it was perfectly lovely!

title: Lowell Hotel
text: Excellent and lovely stay.  Had breakfast there everyday for a week prior and the service was so good we decided to move into the hotel for a night after a stay in a nearby apartment. Had a very nice upgraded room with a little difficulty with the AC.  An engineer came relatively promptly and gave us a whole new AC unit while we were out to dinner.  Everything was perfect after that.

title: Excelletn
text: Stayed here one night in a junior suite.  Outstanding service from check in to check out.  Great location.  Good fitness center.  Room was very nice.  Great bathroom.  This will be my go to hotel going forward in NYC.

title: Fabuleux!
text: Excellent hôtel, très bien situé. Chanbres et salles de bains très confortables.Le concierge (et le maître d’hôtel irlandais) sont particulièrement bien.Seul léger bémol, le petit déjeuner quoique bon lui aussi est servi trop lentement. Superbe endroit. Excellent hotel, perfectly located. Very nice and confortable rooms and bathrooms. The concierge ( and the Irish butler) particularly nice and competent. Only sligh reservation for the breakfast which, if very good, is served much too slowly. Great place

title: So enchanting you won't want to leave the building to explore the amazing city that NYC is!
text:
From the moment we stepped inside the hotel we were completely enchanted by the hotel. The fresh fragrance of a large bouquet of lilies greeted us as soon as we opened the door. Without saying anything, the front desk immediately knew who we were and welcomed us by name. We were so impressed! We were celebrating my husband's birthday. The front desk staff were genuinely friendly and sincerely interested in ensuring that my husband's birthday would be forever memorable. We had requested early check in and a very quiet room and they happily accommodated both. They sent champagne to our room as soon as we arrived. We left to go for a short walk in central park and when we arrived we found two cupcakes decorated with sprinkles and a bottle of champagne waiting for us! 

The bathtub and all of the bath products are sublime. We loved the floor to ceiling white marble in the bathrooms. The room was also quite spacious. 

After resting we relaxed in the club room, which is one of the most beautiful, intimate hotel lounges I have ever stayed in (ranked among the Sujan Rajmahal Palace in Jaipur, and the Jefferson Hotel in Washington, DC). We came back and slept so well all night. In the morning we had a lovely breakfast in the Pembroke room. It was painful to leave. The hotel was so serene, enchanting, and beautiful we didn't want to leave! We have stayed at a number of leading hotels in NYC including the Crosby Street Hotel and the Lowell is easily #1 for the intimacy of the staff (very personal service, treated like royalty from the moment we stepped in), the serenity, and the mesmerizing interior design. 

I will not plan to stay anywhere other than the Lowell next time we return to NYC. A very special thank you to Paul and Armaan for making our stay extra special!

title: The finest hotel in New York
text: If you like serene surroundings as a refuge in the city, with staff who greet you by name and anticipate your needs; if you like the smell of flowers everywhere and the finest hotel rooms and food — stay here!

title: An intimate get-away in one of the world's busiest cities
text: The Lowell is a remarkably intimate, classy, quiet hotel amidst all the hustle and bustle of NYC.  The staff is warm and friendly, while always professional.  The rooms and suites are immaculate and beautiful.

title: A true five-star jewel neighboring the Park
text: The Lowell provided the perfect setting for a much appreciated break from work and other stressors of the day. I’ve stayed in several larger chain and neighborhood hotels from Uptown to the Lower East Side over the years, but I wanted to balance the city’s adventure this trip in a smaller, quieter hotel. The hotel struck every high note: comfortable, clean, tastefully appointed rooms and public spaces (eg, gorgeous flowers everywhere), delicious food created with the freshest ingredients and ample, healthier options (the Chef welcomed me on the first night with three luscious high season nectarines and a bottle of spring water); spectacular service from arrival to departure and everywhere in between; and what I’m most grateful for - a genuinely friendly and professional staff. Given that the Lowell is located fewer than a five-minute trip on foot to Central Park (yet I didn’t hear the traffic on 5th from inside), I took daily, rejuventating morning walks there. In nice weather you might loose track of the fact that you’ve walked 10-15+ blocks to the nearest museums further uptown on Museum Mile, as I did one day to see the Giacometti exhibit at the Guggenheim. I look forward to staying here again on a future trip to NYC.

title: AMAZING HOTEL!
text:
We drove in on a girls trip consisting of my 76 yr old mother, myself and my 2 daughters (14 & 9).  This place is an intimate hotel, you are catered to and taken care of every step of the way.  The accommodations are beautiful and the staff is stellar!
Our first day in the city, my mother tripped and fell on the uneven sidewalks and banged herself up pretty well.  When we arrived at the hotel, (it was late) they promptly brought us an ice bag for her.  The next day, they arranged for us to have a rental wheelchair for her so she would not miss out on our activities.  Anytime we were coming and going, Sean and Jesus were helpful with the chair and getting my mother in and out of the hotel.

title: Impressive Improvements
text:
We have stayed at The Lowell occasionally over many years. It’s our ‘go-to’ hotel in NYC. 

It’s always been a secret gem. Now that they have done extensive renovations and made it even better, I’m sure it will be more popular (sigh). The one thing the hotel needed was a good public space to sit in. The answer to this problem: the new Club Room. It is beautiful, comfortable, and spacious – a much-appreciated place to sit, relax, socialize, or gather leisurely before a meal. (Apparently, it’s where the Post House Restaurant kitchen was). The architectural style offers rich details – coffered ceilings, dental molding, recessed lighting above, high ceilings, and a fireplace. (Unfortunately, it also has a large screen TV that seems out of place given the décor and atmosphere).   

We availed ourselves of The Club Room the first day there. Service was fine – pleasant, attentive, and professional. We had small plates of charcuterie and a grilled cheese sandwich (with brie as the cheese). All was delicious. 

On the second floor, by The Pembroke Room, they opened up a wall to create a refined anteroom and access to the new patio/deck area. That’s a plus as well – the water fountain and patio furniture are inviting. Should be a lovely spot for an afternoon drink before dinner.   

The doormen are great. They are on their game from the minute you arrive to when you leave. One frustration with having the hotel on a residential block is getting a cab. They try but it doesn’t always work. Be prepared to walk over to Madison or Park to hail one. 

The only negative experience was in the Pembroke Room on our second morning there. The first day we had a familiar waiter who’s been there a long time and was very pleasant. The second day we were seated by the maître’d and had a different waiter. We asked for a different table than first offered (the room was less than half full and we don't like sitting in the middle of the room). After seating us, he didn’t take a coffee or juice order which was unusual. We waited ten minutes while others were offered coffee and finally had to ask. When it arrived, I mentioned to the waiter we were ready to order, fearing he might disappear. When he brought the food, he put it down and walked away without even asking if there was anything else we needed. He was not pleasant or helpful.  

Later, when we checked out, I mentioned our uncomfortable experience at breakfast. The front desk staff was apologetic and immediately comped the meal (which I didn’t ask for but appreciated). Problems can occur and it’s how the hotel responds that matters. I give The Lowell high marks – not just for their response to that but for overall professionalism, courtesy, and quality.

title: Birthday Trip to NYC
text: My granddaughter and I had the best time - the staff at the Lowell Hotel went above and beyond to make our trip memorable - from dinner to theater reservations - sightseeing - unbelievable.   I can not say enough about how easy everyone made it for us!

title: A bit disappointing
text: Despite being Leaders club members we were initially given a very compact room just above the kitchen fans which were very noisy all night. This was disappointing for the amount the hotel costs. The room also had a view of a brick wall! The staff were helpful and moved us to a better room higher up without any fuss (I'm sure others must have complained about room 3E). The rooms did not have coffee makers and the supplies of tea bags were not replenished each day and there was no milk in the minibar. The bar is quite stylish and the location is excellent for designer shops and Central Park. The hotel does not compare to other leading hotels we have stayed in around the world. We've not been to NYC before so maybe this is good for NYC? They wouldn't get away with this standard in Dubai, London or Vegas  - not at the price we paid!

title: Long weekend in New York
text: We have always enjoyed the Lowell but it had been some time since we stayed there. Pleased to say this visit was as spectacular as we remembered-  perhaps even more so with the recent renovation of the public spaces. The Club Room (a new addition) was stunning, as were the huge floral arrangements. Our room (junior suite) was tastefully appointed, quiet, comfortable and most important for NYC, immaculate. The only downside to the room was the lack of a view (4th floor). Our schedule didn't allow time to try out Marjorelle, the new restaurant, but we did have time to meet friends in the bar for drinks, and room service was wonderful. Staff was great-  arranged for fresh flowers for the room when we arrived and car service for a night at the theatre. The Lowell is perhaps more expensive than other luxury hotels, but given its intimacy, location and attention to detail, worth every penny.

title: BEST PEOPLE WATCHING!!
text: Brought one of my friends here for martinis after work after a good friend said it was some of the BEST people watching in NYC.  He wasn’t wrong!  If you are visiting this is a must to stop by and have a drink at the front bar or the back lounge area.  Ask for Alasane if he is working as his service was OUTSTANDING!!

title: Gracie713
text:
The Lowell is so incredible. The rooms are my favourite in NY. The Pembroke Room is always a treat for breakfast or afternoon tea. 
The lobby is so inviting and cozy. The staff is always on pointe. Location is beyond compare. 
A must try if you can get in!

title: Excellent in every regard.
text: We had a wonderful stay at the Lowell.   The staff are warm and welcoming and the accommodations are luxurious, the staff are warm and welcoming.  The room we stayed in was beautifully appointed and enhanced our enjoyment of our time in NYC.   Thank you!

title: The elevator!
text:
The elevators sometimes work and sometimes dont. The hotel need to do something about it.
The amenities provided is not complete like other hotels of this standing. No body lotion, no nail file, no toothbrush and toothpaste, just to name a few. Noisy airconditioning unit.

title: Recent Stay at the Lowell
text: We recommend the Lowell highly.   The staff is excellent especially the concierges who greatly assisted us in making dinner and other reservations.   The hotel is quiet and intimate but not too small.   The location is close to shopping and the park.

title: Beautifully renovated! Top location
text: You pay for the location and not really for the size of the room... but everything else is simply divine. Exquisite decor and flower arrangements excellent location. Excellent bar and restaurant in the location

title: Home in Manhattan
text: Looking for a high end hotel which doesn’t feel corporate? This is the place. Although the lobby may be littered with Hermes bags and Goyard satchels, the atmosphere is clubby. You are a member and you have arrived. The hotel is understated and the furnishings are the same. The staff is on the “invisible” side. The door isn’t being knocked on to check your mini bar or ask if everything is all right. It is your home for your stay and privacy is paramount and respected. The Marjorelle Restaurant might be reason enough to stay there. Beautiful, glamorous and amazing food. Don’t stay here for the speed of the internet or up to date gym equipment, however. The rest is marvelous.

title: marvellous hotel on the upper east side
text: The Lowell is a wonderful charming hotel in a quiet street with excellent décor and most courteous, helpful and friendly staff. It has a lovely lounge which is like being at home, in which it is very pleasant to entertain friends.  The bedrooms are beautifully decorated and a restful haven to return to.

title: The best of the best!
text: Elegant dining with outstanding service in all of The Lowell's restaurants. The front desk staff and concierge made our stay truly special. Great location in a lovely neighborhood and within walking distance of 5th Avenue and Central Park. Highly recommend.

title: Upper East Luxury Boutique Hotel
text:
We always stay in small boutique hotels when in NYC, so The Lowell Hotel was a great find for us.  We loved the location and the service was outstanding.  It is truly a Luxury hotel and caters to a more elite crowd, and makes everyone feel welcomed.  We took advantage of it's location near  shopping, Central Park, and fine dinning.  

The hotel is exquisitely decorated and always has fresh beautiful fragrant flowers in the lobby area.

title: Upper East Side Gem
text: If you are looking for a quality hotel in a residential neighborhood that is walking distance to everything on the upper east side of Manhattan, the Lowell Hotel is the answer.  Experience professional staff greet you at the front door and serve you throughout your stay.  The rooms are comfortable, clean and inviting.  The boutique hotel is a gem in a great city like New York that lacks many fine hotels of this quality

title: The Lowell
text: A beautiful and comfortable boutique-style hotel in a  great location.  A staff that is beyond friendly and accommodating.  They could not be any nicer.  The elevators are extremely slow, unfortunately.  The staff acknowledges it, and apologizes for it.  But that's a very small issue.  I would highly recommend.

title: Luxury
text: What a wonderful, relaxing, beautiful hotel. All the staff are courteous, polite and helpful. The doormen always had a smile and were two steps ahead of us. Breakfast was tasty. The room was spacious, clean and inviting. The bathroom feels like a Roman bath. This is a splendid hotel. You get what you pay for.

title: Amazing bar
text:
At the heart of the great hotels of the world, is an exceptional bar. And that's what tells you that The Lowell is on the right path here. Their bar is one of the best. Spacious, immaculate service, expert bar tender, quiet, no crass TVs with no sound. Beautifully decorated.
The rooms are simple. Not vast.  But you're staying a convenient location. The staff are excellent, attentive, friendly... Check-in is fast and awake. Bags somehow get to the room ahead of you, and nobody lurks around in that irritating way telling you how the sofa works. Joking apart, the room has no mysteries. No genius thought re-inventing the light switch would be helpful, or making there TV impossible to operate would be welcome. It all works in its simplicity.
OK... so this isn't a money saving exercise, and that's OK - for one reason - that it's excellent.

title: Enjoyable stay
text: Staff was very friendly and welcoming  The fresh flowers in the lobby were inviting.  Room was very nice and comfortable, although it could use an update in the bathroom.    Only downside is that the breakfast room did not open until 7am, which can be late.

title: Bespoke elegance
text: We were here for a three day layover in October, and it was our first visit to this hotel.  This hotel (and I hesitate to call it that because it's more like your rich aunt's townhouse) and it's management appear to cater to well healed m&a types or international travelers who insist on a quiet place to rest, check emails or entertain clients. The public rooms are  touched with someone's exquisite design taste and budget. There are numerous alcoves with cushy seating and subdued lighting, where you can either grab a drink or just hang and read one of the many coffee table books stacked in 90* angles nearby. My guess is that it's a great place for professionals to stay on business, not having to worry about unwelcome chitty-chat or stranger's attention. The restaurant, although we didn't eat there, looked inviting, albeit budget busting. Room service offered some of the best pomme frites around and every meal we ordered was delicious and on time. There's a dark paneled cubby disguised as an exercise room that has all you need to get in a quick treadmill run. The breakfast room was packed with travelers when we dropped in, but the staff quickly pulled together a table and had us nourished and on our merry way within 30 minutes. The concierge greeted us with a smile and appeared to welcome any challenge. We booked a jr. suite, and our room was described by the front desk staff as an upgrade, although I'm not sure what that meant. The room was not ready when we arrived at 4PM, and although we were giving a conciliatory cocktail in the lounge, they forgot about us, so we eventually had to beg for rest after 1.5 hours. As a matter of record, anytime something happened during our stay that was not perfect, a staff member recognized it. It's hard to get upset when someone is apologizing. Hotel floors are high enough above it's neighboring buildings to afford excellent light and voyeuristic views into gentrified neighbors' apartments, and although we faced the street, the room was very quiet. The room was decorated in chocolate and taupe tones, with lush bedding and well thought out guest controls. There are plenty of USB/electrical sockets on the desk, which for some reason, has always been a missing amenity in upper end hotels in which I've stayed. The bathroom was gynormous, and adorned in polished nickel and slabs of white marble. An elegant boutique in a prime location with attentive service..what more can you ask for? Hotel staff appear to be qualified to host groups much larger than it's petite size allows and I would recommend this hotel to anyone who can afford it.

title: Wonderful people
text: We went to NYC to celebrate a special occasion and The Lowell did everything they could to make it memorable. A welecoming cake with bubbly and attentive, and friendly staff made us feel very welcome. We usually stay in Soho but really enjoyed being by the park this time.

title: A hidden gem in Manhattan
text: We have been staying at this hotel for more then 16 years. It is a very special place unlike your typical big city hotel experience. Imagine staying at your rich uncle’s flat in London or Paris, and being considered part of the family! Great part of town with a hand picked first rate staff that treats you like royalty. Charming, old world, but up to date in all important ways...especially the lobby and lounge renovations, absolute home run inadding to the character and comfort of the place. We look forward to many more getaways to this lovely hotel, cheers!

title: Excelente!
text: Viajei a trabalho a NY e este hotel foi uma ótima opção, apesar de não ser tão barato fica muito bem localizado e atendimento e refeições são espetaculares. O bar do hotel é uma atração a parte, o barmam dá um show de conhecimento e varias dicas de atrações da cidade.

title: Disappointing Experience
text:
My wife and I stay at The Lowell whenever we are in New York.   It has been our favorite hotel for at least the past 10 years.  We were just there from for five nights in December, and had reserved a Deluxe Junior Suite which according to pictures on The Lowell website and accompanying floor plan is appointed with a sofa, fabric chairs, coffee table, desk, some with terraces, etc.  We have stayed in these lovely, spacious suites on previous occasions. 

We were therefore surprised when we were escorted to 12C.   While it has a fireplace, there is no true seating area but only one fabric arm chair and one desk with two side chairs.  We then asked to be moved to another suite and were told in the entire hotel only 12D was available.  It appeared larger with definitely more closet space which we needed; however, it also had only one fabric arm chair, a desk and its requisite two chairs.   Since this was the only other option, we accepted the room, which by the way should be refreshed (frayed drapes, wallcovering with visible and multiple black marks, scarred furniture).

We love The Lowell and its wonderfully attentive staff and assumed that because we were loyal guests and had reserved a Deluxe Junior Suite, our accommodations would meet or perhaps even exceed our expectations.  Unfortunately this was not the case.   We are quick to praise the hotel; however, this is first time we have no choice but to express our heartfelt disappointment.    

I would be remiss if I did not mention that during our stay cold air was escaping from one of the heating units at the far end of the Pembroke Room.  We and other guests at breakfast had to move to the middle of the room or next to an inside wall for warmth.  The problem should have been remedied immediately  but the situation continued all the mornings we were there.

Sent similar message by private email to the General Manager with no reply

title: Disappointing Experience
text:
We have stayed at the Lowell 2 or 3 times before. Nice, small boutique hotel. They recently opened a new restaurant, new, small bar and a beautiful club room 3 years after they closed the Post House. We were told they spent 25 million on the construction and decor. All 3 rooms are beautiful.
Then it ends. We booked a 1 bedroom suite which, on line, shows the layout which include 2 sinks in the bathroom. A lie! We only had 1 small sink.   Plus room is tired, poor decor- a disappointment and not as nice as Peninsula. Then we had coffee in afternoon in Club room, delightful except poor service since no one stayed in the room enough though it has a small service bar- had to go to front desk who called on phone to find someone.
The club room and bar say they stay open till midnight. My wife and I left our dinner at AI Fiori to comeback for a nightcap. We arrived back at 10:40- everything closed. The front desk person told us they closed early because of the snow. Well, what about your hotel guests who are paying $1,000 a night or more. Guess they do not care about their guests.
We are here for 3 more nights but would leave if it was not a hassle to move.
With so many wonderful hotels in Manhattan I would consider others before Lowell.

title: A Very Special Hotel in New York
text: The Lowell is a very special hotel in New York. The experience is more like being welcomed into a wonderful boutique "home away from home". Everything is done with a "touch of class" and extremely comfortable and so friendly and helpful. Nothing is too much for guests at The Lowell. Just perfect.

title: Magnifique
text:
C'est hôtel est un petit bijou magnifique et raffiné; situé dans les quartiers chics de NY, à un jet de pierre de Madison av, ce lieu est une parenthèse élégante dans la ville interlope de NY : les chambres sont ultra luxueuses, tout en vous donnant l'impression que vous êtes à " la maison" : le soir, on vous allumera un feu de bois dans votre cheminée, et vous dormirez dans des draps tissés dans les meilleurs cotons d'Egypte. Les restaurant est tout simplement délicieux, avec un maître d'hôtel français, qui vous parlera la langue de Molière; la décoration est ultra-chic et raffinée avec des bouquets de fleurs changés tous les jours. 
Seul hic, la lenteur du service, particulièrement au petit-déjeuner: l'hôtel devrait comprendre qu'un buffet est la solution lorsque vous devez prendre un petit-déjeuner rapide, ce qui est souvent le cas d'une clientèle affaire. 30 minutes pour obtenir 2 toasts, ce n'est pas sérieux. Et 50 minutes pour un club sandwich en chambre, ce n'est pas sérieux non plus.

title: Always welcome

title: Romantic Week-end in the city for my husband birthday
text:
At soon as you step off your car, bellman will address you by name.  Your car will quickly be taken away while your bags are transferred to the front desk.  Check-in with no hassle or drama. Cordial and relaxed staff attitude's will immediately make feel at home. 
The lovely key with tassel opens a non pretentious door to a heavenly apt like room. If you are lucky to stay at one of the suites, do so. The rooms and suites are well appointed  with classic chic touches.  Our Saturday night stay, was a rainy and very windy evening.  We relaxed and enjoy a complementary glass of champagne while watching tv.  It was my husband birthday and few minutes after we settled in, a bottled of champagne with macaroons arrived. Along with it a bottle of Evian water. Perfect! 
Around 730Pm we went down to the bar, to enjoy a cocktail before dinner at Majorelle.  The bar Jacques, Moroccan style is the perfect setting for an intimate drink.  Superb. Dinner at Majorelle was fantastic.  Can't say enough about the service, the informed and most attentive staff. I had the oysters, lamb tagine and the chocolate soufle and my hubby the mushroom risotto, veal and pistachio soufle. 
All fantastic. 
We came back to our room, and called the butler to light the fire.  Our suite had a wonderful fireplace (real).  Although the logs and the service are extra, for $32 it really's worth it! Specially since outside was so nasty.  Our window showed a whirlwind of tree leaves flying about.  Inside, we were warm and cozy in front of the fire. 
The entire property has a grandiose amount of fresh flowers. This time of year, the theme was pumpkin orange so the flowers were all that color.  Just magnificent.
Next day, we had a delicious breakfast.  Felt like true royalty for a week-end! 
Merci!

text: This is a review of the Lowell hotel itself; not the restaurants or the bar area (though I do think all of those were quite nice). My husband and I stayed three nights in late October. The living room was large and comfortable and the kitchen was very nice. Everything was sparkling clean. It was our anniversary, so they brought up very nice 'treats' and flowers for us. The common "sitting area" just beyond the lobby is really quite fabulous - the perfect place to relax, visit with friends, enjoy a cocktail, or just read. The flowers are magnificent. I believe the whole hotel was recently redecorated, and it is absolutely beautiful. I love the location - close to shopping, Central Park and walkable to good restaurants and a number of museums. We will return to this hotel when we visit NYC in the future, and definitely recommend it.

title: Wonderfully Idiosyncratic
text:
I struggled to rate this hotel four or five stars, as to me it's really four and a half due to a weird beginning.  My visit got off to a rocky start as I was put into an un-renovated junior suite that did not fit the online photos or description including a new bathroom.  They then "upgraded" me to a smaller room with the Michael Smith remodel.  However, I couldn't understand how a smaller room was an upgrade and have never seen a junior suite without a couch. I felt like I was being played a bit.   Dissatisfied, I just upgraded myself and paid for a Garden Suite which was truly lovely but expensive.  I felt like I was in my own pied a tierre replete with terraces and full kitchen.  I loved the room, but was certainly paying a pretty penny.

This hotel feels like old wealthy New York from the roaring 20's or art deco 30's.  It's really a lovely feeling.  The lobby is gorgeous and smells of lilies (where may I buy that scent?).  The Club Lounge is intimately elegant and beautifully furnished and they serve an excellent iced latte (note the lattes served in the room are not nearly as good).   Other parts of the hotel are a bit creaky like the Pembroke Room (feels too dated), the ceiling in the lobby in the elevator bay is unfinished and the hotel's halls have seen better days.  It's time to spruce it all up!

Room service was fast and the food is excellent.  I complained about a few things along the way and they are very quick to apologize with a long note, and usually sent me a little gift of some kind to make up for it (bottle of wine, fruit, a handkerchief).  The staff seem to have worked there a very long time which adds to the very retro ambiance. It's kind of like they expect themselves not to be totally perfect and are sweetly responsive to suggestion when they are not. I also feel like they treat those in more expensive rooms or returning guests better than those in the cheaper rooms.  Once I upgraded, I was treated royally, but before they seemed unsure how to take me because I had randomly booked online.  Just a sense. 

I would stay here again because the location is ideal, the (remodeled) rooms are beautiful but pricey, the food is good and it's away from the hum drum. But, if you are expecting seamless service without any bumps, a spa (sorely missed), and the little oddities of an independently run boutique go to a bigger place like the Four Seasons or Peninsula. I didn't mind them and expect to give a five star review next time.

title: Overhyped but nice
text:
Several leading luxury travel publications report The Lowell as one of the top 5 properties in NYC, and a leading luxury travel forum's members voted the same way. While my stay was good, I didn't get any of the fine luxury touches I would have expected for $1000+ per night at such a highly regarded property. 

I booked via a members-only luxury travel partner that confers certain benefits and recognition, and offered approximately 10% off the public rate. 

The hotel did not reach out to me in advance of my arrival to see if there is anything they could assist with. More and more 5-star properties are doing this, and certainly 100% of the leading properties do it. It was extremely disappointing that The Lowell didn't reach out to me. 

Upon check-in I was told I was upgraded 1 category from a Deluxe Junior Suite to a One Bedroom Suite. Normally this would be good news, but the Deluxe Junior Suite is actually a far more practical room for a solo business traveler and comes with a balcony. After inspecting my 1 bedroom suite I went back down to ask if I could be "downgraded" back to my original room category. I was told no; the hotel had already sold that category out. I then asked if I could be upgraded to the next category up since I really didn't like my room. They offered to do it...for an extra $900 per night.

The hard product itself is high quality, but incredibly dated. It looked as though my room hadn't been PIP'd (remodeled) in nearly 20 years. 

Service downstairs was professional and efficient, but somewhat cold. The concierge couldn't help with the one and only request I had (helping to snag a difficult reservation), but I suppose I shouldn't hold that against the hotel. 

I'd recommend this property for wealthy travelers over age 55, as I think anyone younger would simply find it too dated to be relevant. 

N.B. The hotel apparently spent $20M+ remodeling the public spaces, and those are incredible. It's just the rooms I found disappointing.

title: Perfection in NYC
text:

text:

Have I mentioned the location???

title: People Friendly
text:
After a long absence, trying other unfriendly hotels closer to my Mid-town business meetings, I stayed at The Lowell on my recent trip to NYC and was reminded what a warm, welcoming place The Lowell can be. 

In a word the Lowell's biggest asset is it's staff. More specifically, these are people whose friendly and accommodating attitudes made my stay (including many quirky, jet lagged requests for meals at all hours) a real pleasure. 

If you want a quiet room, ask for one of the rooms, like 4G, which are on the back side of the building. 

If you have a bit more money to spend, then request one of the terrace suites on the higher floors which have balconies which are great for meals al fresco.

text: The Lowell's location is unique the ultimate luxury is privacy in the middle of NYC the personal attention is spectacular such as the picture of my daughter and me next to the bed for Mother's Day! The room and view was spectacular, The tea service is just the way I like it I had it in my room but usually served in the Pembrook roomChampagne and fruit as a snack, the Clubroom is so cozy, feels like a library at a dear friend's home! text: This is a very chic and cozy hotel, on a quiet and pretty street. It's like having  a home in New York.  One is treated like a VIP from the very first stay, by all the staff. title: Very poor service
text:
We stayed at the hotel for two nights and booked two separate bedrooms. 

The hotel is very expensive, more expensive than many hotels in New York. 
We were expecting therefore an impeccable level of service. 

Here are the issues we were faced with:

- One of our family member is highly allergic to nuts. At breakfast we raised this medical condition, and asked the staff to be extraordinary careful. Our family member with this medical condition ordered only a cappuccino. The cappuccino came with a cookie with nuts on the side and when we raised the issue with the staff, the staff just removed it with his bare hands leaving a lot of debris on the cup, with possibly some falling in the cup. This is unacceptable. 

- we asked for a late check out (around 1:30 PM-2PM). We were denied the late check out and asked to leave by 12:30. We then asked if we could stay until 2 PM in the bar or in the ground floor (our flight out of NY was at 18:00). As we have a small dog with us, we were told that they were no area where we could wait. Our departure day was a very rainy day in New York. 
As a result, we reorganized all of our plans, including our car pick up and then about half an hour before we left our room the staff called us to tell us that we could stay until 2PM. Why this was not shared with us when we made that request early in the morning? All our plans were changed and by then our limo was waiting downstairs already. Too late to inform your guests. 

- we asked for a non smoking floor. Each time we walked out of the room there was a very strong cigarette smell. 

- at arrival, it took more than 30mm to have    the luggage delivered to our rooms. 

- at departure, after 40mm, the luggage in one of the room were not brought downstairs and we had to carry them ourself. 

- last, upon departure at checkout, no one bothered to ask us how was our stay. A surprise for a hotel of this price.

title: vornehm in bester Lage
text:
Wer nach NYC reist und in einem 5Sterne Luxus-Hotel wohnen möchte hat 2 Möglichkeiten: entweder "laut" oder "leise", und damit ist nicht der Straßenlärm gemeint sondern die ATTITÜDE des Hotels.

Laut sind alle bekannten Marken und Hotelketten ...
Leise und diskret ist das Lowell, das ich bis zu meiner Ankunft nicht kannte. Also auch so etwas wie ein Geheimtipp.

Zwischen Park Ave und Madison Ave auf der 63 Straße deutet nur ein kleines Vordach und ein paar Flaggen auf das Hotel hin.

Das Erdgeschoss ist vermutlich unendlich aufwendig renoviert und hat die Anmutung einer privaten Villa.

Wie immer bei Zimmern in NYC haben nicht alle Blick, sind sowohl technisch, als auch optisch auf höchstem Niveau, es fehlt an Nichts, die Materialien sind hochwertig , vom Handtuch (die gibt es in großer Zahl) bis zur Bettwäsche usw...

Das besondere Flair aber machen die Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeiter. Besonders erwähnenswert sind die Damen an der Rezeption, die ab dem ersten Moment mit Namen ansprechen , sowie der Concierge, der auch spontane Restaurantreservierungen möglich macht 👏!

Als eine Stubenfrau mein Zimmer für die Nacht fertig machen wollte, ich aber noch anwesend war und meinte, dass das gar nicht notwendig sei meinte sie, dass sie selbstverständlich später wiederkommen werde, es wäre ihr eine Freude, "to take care about you". Großartig, mit welcher Freude alle Mitarbeiter in diesem Haus arbeiten - an dieser Stelle ein großes Dankeschön!

Das Restaurant ist ebenfalls einen Besuch wert!

In diesem wunderbaren Haus , mit einem großartigen Direktor, taucht man für ein paar Tage in NYC ein - so sollten Hotels sein. 

NYC = the LOWELL = NYC

Ich hoffe auf baldige Rückkehr 👋

title: le nid le plus douillet de NY
text: je voyage vraiment beaucoup, et franchement souvent dans les meilleurs hôtels des villes que je traverse, mais le Lowell est mon préféré. C'est discret, confortable, chic, raffiné...le petit dejeuenr est juste parfait, bref, si vous aimez ce style de deco (classique, chic, un peu chargé...), cette hotel est top a NY.

title: An exquisite urban hotel
text: We stay in 5 star hotels in the US and Europe but none surpass the  Lowell. Small, intimate, luxurious, attentive, discrete we are always   made to feel like one of the actual celebrities who stay there. For the ultimate cold weather urban hotel stay ask for a suite with a wood burning fireplace. No US hotel we have visited comes close.

title: Home away from Home
text: There is no place in New York as beautiful as the Lowell.  The rooms are pristine.  The food is divine.  And the staff is amazing.  We looked forward to returning to the hotel at the end of every outing to see the front desk and relax in our homey suite.  Highly recommend.

title: Always fantastic
text: This is the best htel experience in the US bar none.  Worth the price as the experience can't be matched anywhere else I've been in the US.  Majorelle is a bit of a downer comparted to the old Post House

title: The Very Best!
text: As guests at The Lowell is the very best hotel experience we have had! All staff members exemplify care and concern for guests at every encounter. This includes every person from the first person one meets  upon arrival to the last seen at departure!

title: address of heaven: 28 east 63 rd street
text: From the moment you enter the door to the lobby, you have entered heaven. The lobby is pretty and calm and quiet. A respite from the frenetic pace of NYC. The rooms are elegant and comfortable and regal. The staff is seemingly uniformly smart, bright, sweet, happy, and attentive. The entire staff seems as if they should be on a toothpaste commercial! And yet there is nothing fake or artificial. They are the best of New York. It is the reason we kepp coming back. You should, too!

title: The Lowell is our home in New York City
text: Each visit confirms our opinion of the Lowell. The staff remembers us, our names and those of our children. They are attentive to requests, seamless service, elegant in every way. The  new Marjorelle restaurant is spectacular and was filled with long-term customers who also offered glowing praise.

title: Luxurious Home Away from Home
text: The only other luxury hotel experience with which we can compare the Lowell was a stay at George V (Four Seasons) in Paris. The Lowell wins, hands down. It didn't feel so much like a "hotel" as it felt like being a guest in someone's home--inimitable graciousness and hospitality. No cookie-cutter rooms here. Our deluxe junior suite felt like a home--furnishings chosen just for that space, not an all-new-"inferiordesocrator" feel; appointments felt as if they had been chosen by someone who actually loved each piece. The crowning glory of this property is its exquisite Majorelle Restaurant under the unerring eye of Charles Masson, restaurateur extraordinaire. I could go on and on with details, but I think you get the picture! Don't miss an opportunity to be their guest!

title: Best hotel ever
text:
You could never have a problem, all problems are solved before you arrive. Charming,attentive, Corning staff. Proud of the hotel and its 
City. truly an experience of how any hotel should be run, all guests
Comfort and experience are paramount.

title: Lowell hotel
text: We really enjoyed our stay.  The staff and quality of service were excellent.  The Marjorelle restaurant delicious and the decor of the dining room is stunning.  The hotel is very well located close to shops

title: Perfect in every way
text: We have been staying at the Lowell for a number of years now and have always enjoyed our visits. The hotel is beautifully appointed, the staff is friendly and helpful and the location is superb. On this last visit, however, we were greeted with the new lobby and restaurant at the Lowell. The addition is nothing short of spectacular.  The new space provides a warm, inviting area to sit and have a cocktail (with two fireplaces!), and a lovely restaurant to complete the experience. This last visit happened to fall on my birthday and a beautiful Nest candle with a handwritten card greeted me upon returning to our room. There is no reason to look any further than the Lowell for the perfect place to stay in New York!

title: The Lowell continues to be best in class
text: I experienced an amazing stay at The Lowell.  The staff were highly professional, friendly, yet reserved, as we expect from 5-star hotels.  My room was newly renovated and spacious, especially the bathroom.  The fitness centre was simple yet high quality.  I always like staying on the Upper East Side, and The Lowell is perfectly located.  I didn't have breakfast, so can't comment.  The restaurant - Majorelle - for dinner was quite good but New York has many exceptional restaurants.  I would certainly stay there again.

title: Having a good day in New York !
text: I decided to have a change from the usual Soho Hotel I stay in when I'm in New York City and so I decided to go for something that had a more boutique feel to it. I researched and found The Lowell.  It's one of those Hotels that makes you feel you might be arriving at a friends grand family home for a weekend stay. Small and welcoming, organised and orderly and accommodating with friendly staff making you feel at home immediately.  I had booked a room with a view of New York City and was delighted to be offered an upgrade upon checking in, which I was delighted to accept. So of course I was very impressed with my view and accommodation !  The interior of my suite was very spacious, clean, thoughtfully decorated and was very workable. I immediately wished I could have been staying longer than one night !! Nothing seemed too much to ask for and everything from room service to the porter came very promptly.   I met some other guests who both told me they always stayed there every time they came to NY and I always find that sort of information from other guests interesting and pleasing to know about... We had invited some friends of ours to come and have breakfast with us the following morning ( which was delicious ) and we were very pleased to note that the waitering staff did not show any signs of frustration nor concern when our friends turned up with their 10 month old baby. All went smoothly and the baby was taken care of as well as we were, even though he made much more mess of the table cloth that we did. !! All in all, I'm sure I will stay at The Lowell upon my next visit to New York. My only wish these days, without the guest having to request anything in advance is ( and please take into account this mention is in general MOST of the Hotels, not ALL but MOST I have stayed stay in ) and that is.. could Hotels start to include, in their "in room fridges", some better and healthier ORGANIC options of herbal teas and snacks for those who don't drink pesticide laden coffee and nonorganic normal tea and eat sugar dosed cakes and candies ! Really so many people have dietary issues these days and are careful with what they eat, so it would be wonderful for hotels to include, in their thinking of what to offer a guest in their in room fridges, a way to make it easier for guests to have healthier options within their rooms. When your paying top prices for your room or suite this is what should be taken into account as far as I am concerned. Overall we had a pleasant stay and as I said I would have liked to have been able to have stayed a little longer.  Next time hopefully. Bels King-Harman

title: Best place - Hands Down!
text: The Lowell is without question the nicest place we have ever stayed. This was our first time in NYC and they made it so worth it. All of the staff was so incredibly nice! Whatever we needed, it was taken care of, any questions we had were answered very quickly. I cannot say enough about our experience at The Lowell! Thank you so much.

title: Need an update
text:
This hotel is well placed next to Central Park, 5th Avenue and the luxury stores. It's a small boutique hotel, with personal and efficient service. But it's old, and needs an update. We requested another room upon arrival as the first room was worn down and not clean. The other room was nice. But windows are old and noise from the street is very annoying, even from 7th floor. You could hear when car doors was closed at the street. Old noisy air-condition as well. I had to use ear plugs.

Breakfast is over priced, and served in a room with a view to - a building. There is no place to chill out in the hotel, as the main restaurant is being renovated. We would not visit the hotel again, and I do not consider the Hotel to live up to LHW's normal standard.

title: Service is the Lowell's specialty
text: If you have a lot of money and would like to feel very special, the Lowell hotel is the place for you.  The restaurant on the second floor is exorbitantly priced, which is probably why we were one of the only diners there.  We ate both of our breakfasts there because it was included with our room. A plain bowl of cream of wheat cereal is $16! The coffee is delicious and the omelettes and fruit very fresh and good but it should be  absolutely outstanding for the prices commanded.  Great location to subway and Central Park

title: Perfect stay in New York City
text: Everything was perfect in our stay, from the early check in which was a plus to the check out. Staff is great, excellent location in the upper east side, just one block from Central Park. The quieteness innthe room was grest, breakfast too. One of the best hotels we'd been lately. Worth the stay.

title: Week in NYC
text: This is a small intimate hotel with unparalleled service by an accommodating, accessible staff. Excellent location to get around town: easy access to subway, taxis and on foot. Close to Central Park, shopping and museums. The were many "extras" that made the stay at the hotel extra special. I also enjoy the small kitchenette in the room and comfortable room size. We've been coming to the Lowell for years and are only disappointed when it is sold out.

title: Hope away from home
text: My first time in NYC.Amazing place to stay is definitely Lowell Hotel.Madison,Central Park,5th Avenue...you are in the center of the best city in the world and of course it's very important to stay somewhere we're you will fill so racial and loved.Thats how I felt in love with this hotel,stuff and all people from the hotel who made my stay unforgettable.I wish I came back asap.You guys are just awesome.My room was on 13th floor and I loved it!!!

title: フレンチラグジュアリーホテル
text: ローウェルには今まで何度か泊まりましたが、今回もやっぱりローウェルは最高！お部屋はわたしと主人はワンベッドルームスイートで子供とは別々のお部屋での宿泊でした。フレンチ家具に囲まれ、大理石と鏡で出来たバスルーム(タブとシャワーが別々)のコンビネーションがとても素敵なお部屋でした。一歩ホテル内に入るとマディソンアベニューのすぐそばと思えないほど静か、大きなホテルでは到底味わえないプライベートな空間を感じます。ドアマン、スタッフの方々もとても親切です。お部屋に着くとウェルカムフルーツやマカロン、ドリンクをサービスしてくれます。ルームメイドさんとは顔を合わせる事はほとんどないのですが、外出している間にお部屋を整えてくれたり、ディナーに出かけて戻るとシェイドやカーテンが閉められ、ベッド脇にマット、スリッパの用意までされています。それなりのお値段はしますが、生活感のないラグジュアリーな空間での最高のサービスはわたしにとっても最高の癒しです！ただひとつ、ニューヨークの夜景を楽しむ場所ではないです。

title: A very pleasant surprise
text:
Stay at the Lowell. You will love the friendly ambiance and warm style of this hotel. 
The staff is very special and the hotel is warm and comfortable. Not at all like a cold modern chain hotel. 
We had high tea and enjoyed the food and two hours of quite talk time.

title: A wonderful little boutique hotel
text:
We loved our 3 night stay at the Lowell. The staff made you feel like they had the Aloha spirit of Hawaii.  Nothing like a New York City attitude. They treated us like family and friends. 
Our room was upgraded to a junior suite which was a lovely surprise. The room was about 600 sq feet with a very comfortable and warm feel to it. The housekeeping was spot on and not at all over powering. 
We had three very nice breakfasts and a high tea. The breakfast room is quaint and inviting. The breakfast was first rate. We loved high tea. The room and the staff allowed for a quite two hour conversation with noise and rush. The experience was enjoyable and different from the hustle of New York 
The location at Madison and 63rd is perfect for shopping and browsing. Could not say the same for the miserable NYC weather. Boy was it cold. 
Highly recommend The Lowell. We will make this our home in New York City.

title: The Lowell - the best hotel I've ever stayed
text: Each new stay at The Lowell is always an unique experience!! It's as to be back home and feel that all the staff is your family! I don't have enough words to express myself when I stay at The Lowell.  Its uniqueness makes an extraordinary experience but not only because of the quality of the rooms and amenities, but also because of the extraordinary staff with no exception!

title: perfect
text:
We spent four days here after Christmas and it could not have been better. The room as perfect (room temperature was easy to control, very comfortable mattress, and I love the tub/tv/shower). The bellman, doorman and desk were friendly and helpful. The concierge  was one of the best. 
I love the location of the hotel (to walk, to take the subway, etc)
I never saw a person that cleaned the room (ever). I mean, no carts were visible. They were invisible. My room was spotless. perfect.
I am coming back in June for business. I can't wait to come back

title: Amazing
text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay- The Lowell is a special place! The service, staff, location, cleanliness was superb. We have stayed in many, many hotels in New York City and this truly tops the rest !!

title: a jewel
text:
So we normally stay at The Pierre. The hotel was sold out. Maybe I should have known something was up at The Pierre when the person at their in house reservations was kind of clueless. It is always a bit disconcerting when you stay at one hotel a few times every year for the past 15 years and the reservationist can't find your history on the computer. Maybe The Pierre is slipping. Maybe the new reservationist shouldn't be taking reservations. After finally admitting that she had misspelled my name for the past half hour, I kind of gave up. I went on TripAdvisor and found The Lowell. Man, did I get lucky. I called The Lowell and spoke with Nori. I told her my saga with The Pierre: no rooms and no clue. She was only too happy to take my reservation swiftly and accurately. She upgraded us to a suite with a fireplace. Let me be more precise. She upgraded us to suite 16c that is truly fit for royalty. Well furnished. Huge bathroom. Modern kitchen. Perfect bedroom. A real wood fire burning fireplace! However, what makes The Lowell the finest hotel I have ever been in is the staff. Doormen are warm and friendly. Housekeeping staff is uniformly fast and thorough and sweet. The Pembroke Room has perfect breakfast and High Tea. What a hidden oasis of elegance, warmth and serenity. Not to mention, Marty, who brings in his own home made jams that really need to be brought to Shark Tank. There is also a man who is seemingly everywhere in a jiffy to start our fireplace and bring our bags. He may be a ninja. The concierge was perfect. As a native New Yorker, I haven't lived in NYC in 20 years. He sent us to places for meals that were new and cool and perfect for our sons in their twenties to join us. However, the spotlight needs to go the staff at the front desk. I wish I could remember all of their names but they really need to be cloned. Sweet, warm, calm, clairvoyant, professional and personable. Maria, Ms. R., Angelique to name a few. I was going to write down all of their names but that would look too weird. It is hard to leave the front desk when you just enjoy their company! But in all candor, it starts with a reservation. And it started with Nori stating, "well I'll bet you will like us better." She was wrong. I like The Lowell BEST!

Stay here. Treat yourself to the finest experience in NYC.

title: Awesome 5 star Hotel!
text: We absolutely loved this hotel and will definitely be back !  The service was impeccable and the room was great.  Complimentary champagne upon arrival and fresh fruit in our room.    Bed, linens and bathroom amenities were wonderful.  Great location too!

title: The high tea gets low grades
text: When I booked this for a gift for my family I read reviews and compared. It looked good even up against the Plaza. Well I'm so sorry I decided on the poem rook room at the Lowell hotel. The service was terrible, the scones were rock hard, thee food was so little that we were still starving when we were done and your hands needed oven mitts to pour the teapots because the waiters never did it for you. The handles were so hot that you had to use your napkin to hold onto.  The whole thing was a waste. I'm sorry we just came from London where they hold high tea to such a high standard. Don't waste your time or money!

title: Like Coming Home
text: We have been staying at the Lowell for 20 years or so. The location is perfect. Out of the rush and bustle but close enough to walk to museums, theater and dinner. Easy access to the subway.  The rooms are simple, beautiful and comfortable. The staff anticipates needs and makes you feel warm and welcome. The world needs more places like this.

title: Cosy and Comfortable, close to Central Park Zoo...
text:
We spent last weekend in NYC for some pre-christmas cheer, Leslie our Virtuoso Agent recommended we stay at the Lowell Hotel. 

A Small boutique hotel only a couple of blocks away from Central Park (Zoo) the Lowell is just the sort of hotel for us, small, quiet and stylish.

We booked a Deluxe room, which was very comfortable and quiet with a large bathroom.

This being NY the "views" were of the buildings next door, so you did need to use the
privacy blinds if you were in your room and not entirely dressed for success! :)

Although being renovated, we can commend the Lowell on (at least) two exemplary points; room service breakfast (what you imagine it should be, served on a rolling
table, with a flower vase, and *all* the trimmings) and afternoon tea in the Pembroke
room, complete with old world charm, the tranquility of tea there after the crowds of
5th avenue and the insane security around Trump Tower, is a welcome break from
all the madness...

I would highly recommend a walk through the park, especially to visit the small view and to marvel at the beautiful snow leopards there...

Also some dinner recommendations nearby; the Bistro "Chait Noir" on 22 East 66th Street is only about 3+ blocks away, Vacluse is less than a block away (although a little pricey its high style dining) and Amaranth on E62nd is also recommended too!

All in all, the Lowell and its location is a wonderful base for a holiday weekend in NYC
and the staff made us feel very welcome, cant wait to go back once they have completed their remodel.

title: Perfect Stay
text: We stayed st the Lowell for just on night and it was a perfect layover. We have stayed at most of the 5 star hotels in NYC but we now stay at the Lowell exclusively.  The staff always welcomes us back and they are always happy to see us. We love the private atmosphere and hushed luxury that Lowell consistently delivers.  The rooms are elegant, with muted tones and gorgeous bathrooms. The rooms are much quieter than anywhere else we  have stayed in the city. There is not a single thing about our stay that could have been improved upon.

title: lusso tranquillo a new york
text: hotel in posizione tranquilla nell'upper east , vicino alle principali attrazioni di new york, ma fuori dalla confusione della 5th avenue e di Manhattan Midtown. suite bellissime e perfette in ogni dettaglio, servizio perfetto, attenzione al cliente altissima.

title: A Perfect 10
text:
Had a wonderful stay...wish it could have been longer. Would come back with pleasure.  
Have filled this survey out because the service Inreceived is worthy of the time it is taking me to do so...
Am looking forward to the opening of the new restaurant!

title: The Lowell Hotel NYC
text: Excellent boutique hotel with efficient service and luxurious acomodations. Concierge service is excellent and rapid. All staff very engaging and ready to serve.
