The only limitation is the present lack of a bar area and associated restaurant both of which are scheduled to open in the next 30 days. Very quiet for NYC

title: The Wonderful Lowell
text: We only stay at the Lowell when we come to New York. Elegant, comfortable, intimate and lovely wood burning fireplaces in some of the suites. Close to the museums, shopping, dining and all that the Upper East Side has to offer.

title: Back at Home - Only Better!
text: Have travelled to NYC many times, usually staying at the St Regis, Michelangelo, or downtown.  So, this was the first time at The Lowell upon recommendation of a friend.  Great recommendation!!  While not cheap, the suites or lovely and comfortable, like a great house.  The staff is exceptionally friendly and attentive.  The waiter for breakfast actually brings in his homemade jams and shares!  Will definitely return.

title: Quirky Good
text: We could live at the Lowell.  The one-bedroom suite with fireplace and living/dining rooms is delightful.  We enjoyed two warm and cozy real-wood fires (they do all the work for you).   Nice room, great location and excellent service.  The gym is not really a gym and the lobby is not much of a lobby.  The dining room, again, is small and quirky - - right out of set from Arsenic and Old Lace (staff included).  The elevator is dreadfully slow (and small).  A quirky place with some quirky charm.  Very expensive, there are better hotels in NYC for the price, but if you are a private person and are looking for a home away from home the Lowell might suit you well.

title: Not worth it
text: This place is a fortune and I can't really figure out why. Room design is nothing special and service is just adequate. If anything , service is either standoffish or overly attentive which can be annoying. The lobby is under construction so check in is unimpressive. For the super high prices , I'd definitely look elsewhere.

title: Elegant, charming, and super-friendly staff. True 5-star hotel.
text: I truly enjoyed my stay at The Lowell. It was just absolutely marvelous. The room is quite elegant, beautifully decorated yet warm and inviting. The room is also amazingly quiet for being in a such a convenient location. We also loved many wonderful choices of breakfast. But what makes this hotel so special is its outstanding service by the friendly staff. I was searching for a great hotel in New York but my search is over. The Lowell gives you sophisticated comfort, elegance, and impeccable service. If you are a picky traveler, this is the one you should definitely try.

title: THE BEST HOTEL EVER
text: excellent ,so amazing just love love this hotel I have stayed all over NYC and this hotel is my top pick. I was made homemade chocolate chip cookies at 8 pm just for me.. What can be better!! YOU MUST TRY IT!!

title: Amazing Hotel!
text: I cannot recommend the Lowell enough!  The staff were very friendly and happy. The location was perfect. Breakfast in the quaint little room.  If you are looking for a centrally located small and friendly hotel please do book the Lowell.  You will not be disappointed!

title: Excellent Customer Service
text:
We've stayed at The Lowell several times over the years - only hotel we stay at in NYC. The small gem is well-located in a quiet upper E. Side neighborhood and offers a luxe experience. 

Recently, we were to stay at the hotel while we attended a jazz show (in Sept.). Unfortunately I became ill and unable to travel. I made the mistake of booking through GetARoom (Expedia) and could not get a refund for one night even though I tried to notify them and follow procedures. Long story short - The Lowell went above and beyond and got this all straightened out for us. 

In this day and age when problems arise, many businesses are not great at customer service. The Lowell was and it is appreciated. They deserve high marks for their help and outstanding service.

title: Always friendly and low key
text: The staff is tremendous, but should be given the pricey rates.  It's a location and an atmosphere that keeps me and my family coming back.  Only negative is the ongoing renovation of the lobby restaurant and the now begun lobby renovation.  Both temporary and hopefully short term.

title: Excellence in every way
text: I have stayed in many 5 star hotels including Mandarin Oriental, several Ritz Carlton's, Waldorf Astoria's, Bellagio, Four Seasons and more. Not one compares to the exclusive and highly personalized service I received during my first stay at The Lowell. Impeccable. Every single detail is taken care of from the moment you arrive until the moment you leave.  If you, like me, appreciate elegance, style, privacy and excellence in professionalism and service, The Lowell is the hotel of choice. Deluxe Junior Suite with Terrace

title: Afternoon Tea at the Lowell, an Elegant and Tasty Treat to End our NYC Stay
text: My mother and I recently had tea at the Lowell but were not able to stay in the hotel.   The tea was fantastic with everything fresh, tasty, and piping hot as expected.   I had done a tremendous amount of research on tea locations in New York because my mother considers it the next best thing to heaven and we were both so glad we chose the Pembroke Room.   The surroundings are elegant yet you are perfectly at ease, the waitstaff is gentility and service personified, and the selection of teas is appropriate for the delicious nibbles.  We would go again in a heartbeat!   The only little quibbles was that it took a long time to get the check, something we saw and heard complaints about from other tables as well, and the desserts are not the crowning glory of the meal but the sandwiches and pillowy soft warm scones more than make up for it.

title: Luxury personified!
text: If you are looking for a luxurious weekend and like to be pampered this is the place for you! Beautiful accommodations and an attentive staff. Highly recommend! Will even be better when their new restaurant opens.

title: The Lowell: The epitome of understated elegance
text:
From the floral scented lobby, to the generously sized rooms, to the gracious staff, the Lowell is perfection. Every detail is anticipated -- umbrellas in the closet, fruit and cupcakes on the table, and a lovely glass of champagne that was delivered a few minutes after we arrived. 

The shower had excellent water pressure, the bathroom was laid out in white marble, and there were 3x the towels we needed. 

The floor was quiet. We rarely heard traffic. Even the HVAC was quiet.

The housekeeping is immaculate.

I cannot imagine staying anywhere else.

title: Superb boutique hotel with fabulous location
text: My daughter and I stayed at the Lowell Hotel and found it to be everything we wanted in a hotel. It is just gorgeous with fresh and modern touches set in old world charm.  Our room was pristine and the beds were very comfortable. The service was excellent and the food was fantastic. The bathroom was really stunning with white marble all around. Attention to detail was paid throughout our stay when we were greeted with herbal tea and fresh fruit in the room. The location is fabulous set off of 5th avenue on a quite street. We will definitely be coming back.

title: Spectacular
text:
This hotel was recommended by my travel agent when my usual NY hotel was fully booked. I had not previously heard of it, but I was super impressed and loved my stay there. It's a completely different experience to other large NY hotels. It's more intimate and you instantly are made to feel at home - staff all seemed to know my name, nothing was too much trouble, the room was spectacular and very spacious (unusual in New York), and the location is unbelievable - uber prime Manhattan real estate one block from central park. 

It's the staff and service that make this hotel unique. A minor mix up at check-in was followed up with a handwritten note of apology - very classy. A brief introductory conversation with the friendly marketing head in the elevator was similarly followed up with a hand written note and offer of assistance. I don't even remember mentioning my surname, but somehow she knew who I was and made the effort to reach out personally. These little touches make all the difference in my opinion. Returning from a days business meetings, you are greeted personally and with a smile from the staff at reception. The concierge was great, booked me into Le Bilboquet for a very fun night, and helped me with the best train route to JFK to avoid gridlock during UN week. 

The breakfast is excellent and the again the service is faultless. The gym is well equipped and local gyms are also available for classes (SoulCycle, or Equinox). 

I honestly didn't want to leave ! Highly recommended (although would prefer to keep this gem to myself). Definitely staying here in NY from now on.

title: The Lovely Lowell
text: My stay at The Lowell was unexpected and what a lovely surprise!  The service here is unmatched...they helped me move into a beautiful suite. It was intimate and charming giving you the feeling of having your own private apartment.  Room service was prompt and delicious. The bathroom was large and luxurious with a soaking tub with built in television. The beds are super cozy with Frette linens. There is construction going on right now which is a little distracting,  but again the service is impeccable and makes the experience so lovely.  Great location,  can't wait to return!

title: The Lovely Lowell
text: My recent stay at The Lowell was not planned,  so it was a lovely surprise to be met by such an attentive staff. They helped me move into a beautiful well appointed suite. Room service is prompt and delicious.  The bathroom was very large white/gray marble with a fabulous soaking tub and built in television. Great vanity and shower. There is construction going on at the hotel at this point so there was some noise and I was a little disappointed for the amount of money charged per night there was no view or terrace as it said when I booked. But I did love the intimate feel as if you were in your own little apartment, very sweet and lovely.

title: Jewel of The City
text: Most excellent standards, service and amenities. Beautiful environment and extraordinary staff. Location is divine. Rooms are like a lovely guest room that has everything you would want or need. Never miss a chance to nest at The Lowell.

title: Enjoy being surrounded by the 1%
text: Beautiful hotel in quiet residential area. Walk to high end shops and Central Park. At this price point you expect 5 star service and receive it. We had a "regular" room with a comfy king bed and a nice size marble bathroom. Size is average for nyc around 400 sf. Frette linens and high end toiletries and towels. Issue is that there is construction going on with an alternate lobby and construction noise. Otherwise this hotel is on par with other 5 star properties with 24 hour room service and opulent surroundings. It is a small hotel and part of both Amex fine hotels and LHW. You are definitely paying for the location...but if you can afford the rates go for it.

title: Amazing customer service
text: I had the pleasure of staying at the Lowell hotel in the month of September 2016. I must say I was absolute blown away with the attention to detail at this hotel. You truly feel cared from the moment of your arrival, it's as if they have been waiting for your arrival all day. Everything feels so personalized. I found our junior suite to be beautiful and spacious. I would definitely recommend the Lowell hotel to everyone it is worth every penny!!!

title: Beautiful Boutique Hotel
text: This elegant upper east side hotel was close to all the luxury brands -2 min walk to world class fashion. Their were small cafes and restaurants all along Madison Ave. The perfect location and the weather was cooperative as well this time of year at a steady 71-73 degrees. The front desk and the manager were very kind and friendly. They made sure our room was ready ahead of time and that it was quiet on an upper floor. (They are currently renovating of one of their restaurants called The Pembroke Room on the first floor but the construction was minimal for the holiday weekend- we didn't hear a thing.) We enjoyed breakfast on the 2nd floor and loved the French style ambiance. We took advantage of our AMEX Platinum breakfast every morning. The gym was also on the 2nd floor and was large as well- a few treadmills, an elliptical, and  free weights, bosu ball, and weight machines. Fresh water and Gatorade in the fridge. Fresh towels and a tv. I utilized the gym one morning and it was pretty quiet. The Lowell bedroom we stayed at was impeccably clean and modern. We had approximately a 400 sq ft room with a king size bed. Very soft and comfortable! (And large for NYC standards!) The bathroom was large and marbled in grey and white. The only negative on the whole experience was the concierge who gave us names of cafes and restaurants that were chain restaurants. We wanted unique and gourmet. All in all we really enjoyed our stay and would highly recommend this boutique hotel again!!

title: Renovation work diminished the quality of our stay
text: We were upset to find the hotel undergoing substantial renovation work. This was not made clear when we booked, and not reflected in the price. There was construction noise starting early in the morning, no bar and a temporary restaurant The staff were very nice, but couldn't make up for this. The hotel should be closed during this extensive work, or at least substantially discounted.

title: Always terrific
text: Super boutique hotel.  Very quiet and well located. The overall experience is one of elegance.  People are very nice and eager to make sure you have a great experience.  Current renovation does not interfere with the customer.  No noise in the morning.

title: Un encanto
text:
Me he alojado en distintos hoteles en Manhattan -algunos onderos, otros impersonales- pero nunca había estado en uno pequeño, tipo boutique, y además tranquilo, clásico y con trato muy personalizado. 
La habitación era muy cómoda, el baño excelente (los productos de la ducha y la tina, exquisitos) y te ordenaban la pieza dos veces al día. 
El desayuno (algunos días lo pedimos a la pieza, otro día fuimos a tomarlo en el Restaurant) era muy bueno y tenía todas las cosas que queríamos. 
El hotel es como un muy buen hotel inglés en pleno Manhattan (la ubicación es insuperable: en la 63, a una cuadra de Madison y dos de central park), con una atención impecable, con detalles que te hacen sentir muy cómodo y con la excelencia y el trato europeo que muchas veces ya no se encuentra en NY.

title: A home away from home
text: Super nice stay in the property The front desk and concierge are talking with you like family, and meanwhile offering service Excellent breakfast, the best croissant i have ever had in my lifetime. Already missing the bed.

title: Still the best
text:
We have not stayed at the Lowell for ten years.  It has always been our favorite Hotel in New York.  Well the good news is it keeps getting better.

Hotels are all about service/ and service is about people.  Well from start to fining the staff is first rate (without being stuffy).  The rooms are tastefully decorated with great amenities.  

We wanted reservations at a top rated restaurant but they said they were all booked up.  The concierge worked very hard on the issue and got us in.  

Yes, it's price, but you will find it worth it.

title: A perfect gem
text: If you are seeking an intimate and peaceful retreat in the city then The Lowell is the perfect choice. Forget the attractions of mega hotel chains - this is a traditional, family run hotel where personal service is king. Expect to be remembered and addressed by your name - and welcomed every day with genuine warmth and courtesy. Decor is traditional. Rooms are  a good size for the city. Bathrooms are generously sized and very well appointed. Suites do have nice views with very pleasant terraces - and at a height that won't give you vertigo. Rooms generally do not have anything in the way of a view. But it is relatively quiet and peaceful for the city centre.  Everything is on a human scale here - a home away from home - as the hotel publicity says - and it is true. The hotel is unique in the NY for having wood burning fireplaces in some suites - very cosy and romantic for the winter months. Great breakfasts served in the Pembroke room by very attentive and characterful waiters. In fact this hotel has character oozing from every corner.

title: Best in NYC
text: It's like having a private luxury apartment in NY. Intimate entrance and check-in experience leads to immaculate, classic decor and service. We have stayed at the top hotels in most U.S. and European cities, and the Lowell is among the very best.

title: A Hidden Gem In New York City
text: I will never come to New York City again, without a reservation at The Lowell Hotel.  This property fit my expectations of service, amenities and quality of the room. The attention of the staff was beyond  reproach.  The in room bath products, which I usually skip, were of superior quality, that I am now searching the web to buy them for my regular use at home.

title: Solid
text: Its a small hotel. Its very discrete with excellent service and room finishes. The hallways are narrow and there are no views. Its location is excellent v close to top line boutiques and restaurants. Service was very solid

title: Disappointed about just one thing...
text:
One of my friend stayed at The Lowell and I helped him carry one box and put on a chair when he checked in.
An old porter came to me during his registration, pointing out and said "This is dirty!".
Then he took it and placed on the floor. If I am asked to do it I will of course do so accordingly but he was so rude. All other employees were amazing so totally disappointed by him. He didn't even help me carry...

title: Perfect Pied-à-terre
text: We have stayed at many beautiful hotels in NY but after staying at the Lowell we will make it our New York constant. It's an elegant sanctuary where no detail is overlooked. After an exhausting day of layover's and cancelled flights I arrived with my children and we were greeted like long-lost residents. The touches in our suite, like hot chocolate and macaroons for the children, were much appreciated. The decor is sophisticated and smart with thoughtful amenities. However, what really made our stay stand out was the staff. Every single person we encountered, whether in the dining room or elevator was a consummate professional. But warm too! We were always greeted by our names with a smile. The front desk and concierges are exceptional. I was remiss to write this review, wanting to keep the Lowell our hidden gem but our lovely stay warranted one. Well done Lowell we will be back again and again and again...

title: Beautiful rooms with excellent staff
text: The hotel is an excellent place to stay if you are looking for quality in your room, amenities, and staff attention and courtesies.  The room is luxurious and the bathroom is the largest I have seen in New York City.  The location is convenient, yet quiet.  The staff know you and do everything possible to make you feel welcome and appreciated.

title: A Fabulous Stay!
text: My husband and I just returned from another fabulous stay at The Lowell Hotel.  It was the tail end of a trip abroad...and we so looked forward to the comfort and sophistication we knew this hotel would offer.   Once again...we had a beautiful room with a fabulous and very comfortable bed...topped with down pillows and quality linens.  We also had a spacious and nicely appointed marble bathroom filled with an abundance of fluffy towels.  We are frequent and knowledgable travelers...and the The Lowell Hotel with it's great service, nice quiet location and beautiful rooms sets itself apart from other hotels in New York and elsewhere.  We've already booked our next trip and can't wait to return. The Lowell is a hotel we could not recommend enough!

title: Lovely 5* hotel
text:
We enjoyed a three night stay expecting true, 5* service and our expectations were exceeded on Every front.  All the staff greeted us by name, their attention to detail and service were superb. Hard not to enjoy the location either, convenient to everything. 
Amenities in our suite were top notch from the Frette linens to more big white fluffy towels than we could ever use. There was a glorious oversize, deep tub comfortably large enough for two to share a bath. The DDC28 bath amenities were of generous size and a lovely, unobtrusive scent. Turn down service, shoe shine, etc., a true 5* service level I highly recommend. I understand there will be a new restaurant opening on property in the fall. Can't wait to return to this lovely, boutique hotel.

title: Luxury, high quality shows throughout.
text: The Lowell met and exceeded our expectations on Every front. From the superb location, the staff attentiveness and attention to detail is unsurpassed. Everyone from the doorman to the maids are unfailingly professional and provide service with aplomb. The bedding is 5*, bath amenities are divine, service in the restaurant and food quality are excellent. The Lowell lives up to it's 5* reputation. We highly recommend this hotel and will return. Actually, I'd prefer to move in - permanently!

title: Great Stay
text: The hotel is beautiful.  The staff is genuinely friendly.  I really enjoyed my stay here.  Fresh fruit in the room, a personalized note and the staff is really very nice and part of the whole experience.  Great job done at this hotel.

title: Poor service
text:
Stayed in there for 2 nights.
First when me and my friend got there they messed up with booking and gave us 1 bed instead of 2 mentioned while booking a room. Then when they changed it to 2 beds we have got a room which was so poor looking that I could barely rate it for 3 stars. Small and terrible view.
The hotel is very old with a lack of facilities. 
No restaurant or terrace on site.
Breakfast was included but food isn't delicious and was delivered to our room in 1 hour instead of promised 20 mins 2 days in a raw, ridiculous.

title: First Class Boutique Hotel
text: The Lowell Hotel is one of the finest hotels I've ever experienced. A bit out of the way but 100% worth the effort. Excellent staff, rooms and ambience. Very private with the most elegant breakfast room in the world. The hustle and bustle of NYC is forgotten when you enter this Hotel.

title: HIDDEN GEM IN A BIG CITY
text:
If you want to be away from the hustle and bustle of the big city and enjoy a small 5 star hotel, then The Lowell is perfect for you.
From the doorman on arrival until you leave the hotel, you feel like you are home.
The service is outstanding...accommodations are lovely and the staff is warm and welcoming.

title: Attention to detail, kindness & care.
text:
We stayed at the Lowell for 4 nights at the beginning of the month. We really liked this
hotel.  We were happy with our room (with fireplace) and the bathroom & although no view, it was lovely and quiet and had everything we needed. More than that, there was even a little kitchen which we hadn't expected. My only quibble is that the bed was rather
wobbly! If one of us moved the whole bed moved(!) Usually hotel beds have a very firm
matress & base.

The hotel really came into its own when my husband had a bit of a medical problem. All of the staff were really caring and kind which meant a lot when one was a bit jet lagged and a long way from home. The charming girls at the front desk and the concierge, Mr Hopkins were endlessly helpful and I can recommend this excellent hotel whole-heartedly.

title: Warm welcome during a tough time
text: This place is amazing!  They went out of their way to make my family and I welcome and they succeeded!  This hotel is tucked away on a quiet street and just two blocks away you have Central Park.  The bathroom floors are heated!!! I loved it! The furnishings were beautiful as well as comfortable and the staff were very professional yet welcoming.  I had a food delivery and they took care of paying and just adding it to the bill.  They also went above and beyond!  Is it expensive? Yes, but I have been to other expensive hotels and they don't have an attitude of making client's happy while this one does.  The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because of our experience in the Pembroke Room.   We were celebrating my sister's birthday and asked the concierge if we could have lunch there and bring cupcakes.  We arrived and waited 10-15 minutes before I finally called the concierge and asked why no one was helping us.  There were other tables and tables that came in after us and had immediate service.  He came up and literally a minute before he got there a waiter came over to offer water.  25 minutes after we arrived we finally got to order.  The chef and manager of the restaurant did come over and ask if the food was good and if everything was ok at the end of our meal.  I was disappointed because I wanted my sister to feel special on her day and it fell desperately short.  The room service food was delicious although there were a couple of times that it was cold when it got to my room. That being said I would definitely stay here again.

title: Wunderbares Hotel
text: Ein kleines Hotel mit wenig Aufwand, schmaler Eingang, kleine Rezeption, die Zimmer in den unteren Stockwerken ebenfalls nicht besonders groß, in den oberen mit Terrassen und Balkon. Jedes Zimmer perfekt inszeniert wie ein Raum für die Filmszene. Alles passt, alles funktioniert und sieht gut aus. Ein angenehmes Bad mit einer Nagelschere. Es fällt einem nichts ein, was man kritisieren könnte, man fühlt sich einfach wohl dort, freundliche menschen tragen die Koffer, fragen einem nach besonderen Wünschen und empfängt einen wie einen verlorenen Gast, der eigentlich sonst jedes Jahr kommt...

title: Home from Home
text: My wife and I returned to The Lowell after an absence of a few years and were greeted with the comment 'Welcome Home' and it truly felt like we had returned home. The hotel is a remarkable establishment tucked away in a quiet side street on the Upper East Side, yet convenient for pretty much anywhere you wish to visit. The rooms in The Lowell are spacious, comfortable, quiet and well appointed,  with a convenient well appointed small kitchenette. What sets the hotel apart from others is the quality of the staff and the service offered by them. Nothing appears to be too much trouble and even when we checked out at 5.15 a.m. the reception and night porter were ready to assist with a smile and 'looking forward to your next visit'. Breakfast in the Pembroke Room was elegantly served and the quality of the food excellent. We will return to our 'Home from Home' in New York.

title: I chose my own firewood!
text: This hotel is a luxury boutique to the max!  Hidden away on the prettiest street in NYC, you are instantly taken away from the hustle and bustle to your own little castle.  You can choose what fragrance firewood you would like.  the hotel products are fantastic and the Pembroke room is wonderful!

title: Another Perfect Stay
text: My wife and I just spent another perfect weekend at the Lowell. I am not sure what it is that make us love this hotel so much. The staff are all wonderful. The front desk personnel do everything they can to make me feel cared for. They are elegant and understated, like everything at this hotel. We had a spacious, quiet room with a working fireplace and a drop-dead gorgeous bathroom. I can't wait to go back

title: Home In New York
text: Lowell is the definition of Luxury, The most luxurious hotel in NY, the rooms are very spacious the attention to detail by the staff is amazing. The amenities are all top of the line. (did not even know Bulgari made shampoo) The breakfast in room is legendary. After a long day in the city you will be happy to have a room in this hotel. The Lowell is a real 5 star boutique hotel, A must go to when visiting NY

title: Amazing..Beyond Amazing, Really
text:
We recently spent a romantic weekend in New York.  We chose the Lowell because it had a wood burning fireplace in the room.  It had that.. and so much more.

The hotel was gorgeous, the staff impeccable, the location perfect, the concierge outstanding. Having stayed at fine hotels around the world for the last 30 years, I am pretty confident this may be the finest small hotel in the world.

title: Outstanding Experience-perfect in all respects--5 Stars
text: The service was impeccable and I am a service snob! Excellent English Tea in the Pembroke Room as well. The staff in this hotel seemed to really be aware of the guests and I really appreciate this! Very friendly and classy staff.

title: Fantastic location, great service
text:
We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Lowell. When we weren't happy with the original room we were booked in, they spent a lot of time getting us into a room that suited us very well. The location is superb - we walked everywhere, the Met, The Frick, Columbus Circle, and the restaurant Danial is just around the corner. And is so nice to escape the hustle and bustle but still be right in the heart of where we wanted to be.

We had an excellent room service meal. We did not enjoy the breakfasts however and we had one meal in the dining room that was not good either. I'm sure once they complete those upgrades it will be hard to beat.

title: Fabulous afternoon tea
text: If you enjoy doing afternoon tea then I highly recommend the Pembroke Room at the Lowell Hotel.  The food was delicious and the service was great.  All of the staff bent over backwards to make sure we were happy.  The room itself was comfortable and very beautiful which will make you feel like you are at home.  We were not rushed to finish our tea/food nor were we rushed to leave, which is very welcoming.  This is a go-to destination for out-of-towners as well as New Yorkers.

title: Spectacular!
text:
My husband and I have been staying at the Lowell for years. We have also stayed at the Ritz Carlton (Central Park), The Pierre and the Palace to name a few. Once we stayed at the Lowell, we have never stayed anywhere else. The hotel is in the perfect location with service to match. The suites are classic, elegant and very comfortable. There are orchids in each room and a gorgeous bouquet of white roses always arrives on the first day of our stay. The staff is warm and welcoming and the Concierge, John Mark Hopkins is a joy. He secured a reservation at the coveted Polo Bar on our last visit at Christmas. The new general manager, Mr. Heiko Kuenstle has personally greeted upon arrival each visit this past year. He is truly passionate about the Lowell and his accomplishments are evident. Upon arrival, if your suite is available, it's yours. This past visit we arrived at 10:30 a.m. We were checked in immediately! A gift of an extra day!  This hotel also does its best to upgrade your room reservation. Last year, December  2014, we reserved a two bedroom suite, as our daughter was coming in from out of town. They upgraded us to the Penthouse!
 I could go on - from the wood-burning fireplaces to the impeccable room service, to say nothing of housekeeping - anything you need, they provide, with a smile!

title: excellent hôtel
text: staff hyper agréable, le concierge toujours disponible et efficace, l'hôtel très bien placé et vraiment tranquille, le chambre très bien equipée, le service excellent et rapide, très bon hôtel, très cosy, par rapport au BIG (the pierre, plaza, etc...) et une équipe toujours prête à vous aider

title: Old Standby
text: The front desk and bell staff and updated room were terrific, although mechanical issues (shutoff of water announced after we checked in) and no hot water the next morning were inconsistent with a premier hotel.

title: In New York what more can one want?
text:
The Lowell is the best hotel in the world. 
To stay at the Lowell is also experiencing New York at its best! 
It's very difficult to find a Hotel without something that we don't appreciate!
But at The Lowell you enjoy everything!
The rooms are greatly equipped and outstanding. Those with fireplaces are unique! 
And if you stay at The Lowell you are going to meet the best staff you can find in a hotel: friendly, warm, knowledge, discrete, well-mannered. From the bell-boys to the office people all are amazingly well-prepared to deal with everything and you feel completely pampered. You'll make a part of a great family and you feel at home!
For all those reasons and much more The Lowell is the best hotel in the world.

title: Top Class Luxury Hotel in NYC
text:
Classy, luxurious, confortable hotel in the best location possible: Upper East Side, a stone's throw away from Central Park. Spacious suites with all the amenities one can imagine...and some even have fireplaces :)
The staff are amazing, no exceptions! 
My best experience in NYC ever.

title: Hidden Paradise in Upper East Side
text:
For our first ever stay in New York we were truly spoiled in one of the gems amongst the New York luxury hotels...
Amazing Suite with a view and a very nice welcome treat as well as a super attentive staff made our stay unforgettable!
A special thanks to Heiko Kuenstle and all his team.

The Lowell is quite central - yet a bit hidden and though very calm - located only two minutes from Central Park.
The restaurant is about to be renovated but you have a rich room-service menu to choose from and a nice tea room where breakfast and afternoon tea is served.
Either way we think a stay in a Boutique Hotel has many advantages in comparison to the 50+ floor Hotels!

title: Another wonderful stay!
text: My husband and I just returned from our most recent stay at The Lowell.  We have stayed many times at this hotel...and each and every time we come away pleased and looking forward to our next stay.  The Lowell is a lovely hotel...well located on the Upper East Side...with easy access to great shopping along Madison Avenue or Fifth Avenue...Central Park  just a block away...and Museum Mile within walking distance.  From the beautifully appointed rooms that are both tasteful and comfortable...to the warm and friendly bell staff...the excellent housekeeping staff...and the superb concierge John Mark...we feel as if we have found our home away from home.  We've stayed at many other luxury hotels in New York...and none come close to providing the same level of service, comfort and friendliness.  Our Thanksgiving stay was just perfect!

title: Home away from home
text: Upper east side's gem. Our favorite staycation and afternoon tea destination. My daughter's favorite place to be. Once you walk into the lobby, you feel so special. From the door to the Pembroke room, they called us by name. The beds are heavenly, difficult to wake up from... Wood burning fireplace is something we truly enjoyed. On our first stay, my daughter loved the scallops wrapped in bacon at the restaurant. The second time we stayed, they changed their menu, my daughter ordered it and provided her with an alternative.. But the following day, they delivered it to our room with our dinner order- something she'll never forget! My friends and I frequent The Pembroke Room for afternoon tea- the best service... I can't wait till they open their new restaurant! Will always recommend the Lowell!

title: A secret little spot for high tea.
text: If you're looking for a quiet, secret (great place for an assignation, I'm told) little spot for high tea, this could be just the spot for you. It's not inexpensive, by high tea standards, but it was a very generous amount of food and the savory sandwiches are some of the best I've had.

title: Good morning, Upper East Siders
text:
First of all, the location of the Hotel speaks a lot for itself. The iconic Upper East Side is chic and classic. 
Upon arrival we were warmly greeted by a very attentive receptionist who was extremely nice. Not to mention this cozy atmosphere at the lobby and the scent of chocolate. It makes you so warm after the rainy day in the city.

A complimentary glass of champagne was offered to us at the restaurant of Hotel and were charmed by the French atmosphere of restaurant.

We got an "old-fashioned" key to our room not the electronic key cards which are so popular nowadays. And we really liked it. That somehow connect you with the Hotel and you can feel the history of this place. 

The interior of the room pleasantly surprised us by its design: so stylish, so comfy. We even had a small kitchen to make some tea and coffee. You know how Russian people drink tea all the time.  

Every day you will be offered a really good selection of breakfast.

Personal touch during our stay makes a lot: one day we receive the fruit basket, the other day – small present (leather good) and complimentary voucher for 5 o’clock tea.

That's the key difference from other luxury hotels on Manhattan. 

We absolutely loved this hotel. I think it was one of the most pleasant experience we have ever had in our life. 

Anyone who is looking for incredibly relaxing and warm atmosphere in the heart of vivid city should stay at The Lowell Hotel.

title: Bumped from a prepaid reservation
text: Prepaid for my reservation on orbitz. Upon arriving at the hotel, was told that there was no longer a room available for me. They gave two different stories: the first was that someone who had stayed the night before in the hotel was sick and was unable to check out. Someone else said that someone in the hotel hadnt returned from the night before and they were prohibited from lawfully removing his possessions from the room. It seems far more credible to me that they overbooked the hotel and bumped me. The Lowell refunded my money and arranged for me to stay at a lovely nearby hotel at no charge, but I was traveling with other people on business and this whole experience was embarrassing and inconvenient. I would avoid this hotel and stay at a hotel that honors their commitments.

title: Klein, aber fein!
text: Ich hatte für den Abend andere Pläne, aber nachdem ich in mein Zimmer geführt wurde und bei herrlicher Abendsonne staunend von dem Balkon über die Dächer der upper east side und den Central Park im Hintergrund blickte, dachte ich, schöner kann man doch nicht in Manhattan ankommen und bestellte mir ein herrliches Abendessen aufs Zimmer. Im Lowell finden Sie ein ganz privates Hotel: ruhig, elegant, höchsten Ansprüchen genügend und altmodisch im besten Sinne ( - vielleicht weil es keiner aufdringlichen internationalen Hotelkette angehören muss?) Ich hoffe, dies bleibt alles so, freue mich auf den nächsten Aufenthalt - hoffentlich mit meiner Familie - und danke der Mitarbeiterin am front desk für den wunderbaren Empfang und die herzliche Betreuung!

title: Una settimana fantastica
text:
Sono stata qui con mia mamma ed entrambe siamo state completamente soddisfatte sia dall'accoglienza e dalla professionalità del personale, sia dal comfort offerto dalla camera e dalla struttura. Ottima anche la posizione di questo albergo, lontano dal caos e dai rumori del traffico. 
Peccato che l’adiacente Post House fosse chiusa per ristrutturazione. In compenso, abbiamo apprezzato la Pembrooke Room, situata al secondo piano, per un brunch squisito.
Unico aspetto da migliorare, il rumore del fancoil per raffrescare la camera. In ogni caso, quando abbiamo fatto presente il problema al personale, ci è stata immediatamente proposta un’altra camera. Inoltre, il direttore si è scusato con un gradito presente. Servizio veramente ineccepibile, come ci si aspetta dal personale di un albergo di tale levatura. 
Se ci si organizza per tempo, come abbiamo fatto noi, si potrà anche approfittare di alcune promozioni presenti sul web (nel sito dell’hotel e non solo), con la certezza di trascorrere un soggiorno al top.

title: quiet, private luxury & service
text:
NO coventioneers need apply !  Quiet, distinguished, personal polished service.
Pre theater dinner served in a cozy delightful dining room. Wonderfukl breakfast in the same room or outstanding room service.

Discreet, also many wood burning fireplaces, may well be the only hotel in New York with that feature.  Absolutely delightful, restful island in Manhattan

title: Overpriced small hotel
text:
Stayed here to attend a funeral in NYC.  The hotel room is fine, but compared to the pricing of other hotels in NYC it is incredibly overpriced for what one gets.  The suite was small, the price extraordinarily high, the service eh.  The best service people at the hotel were housekeeping and the bell staff, they were excellent.  I did not eat there so I have no idea about that part.  The front desk staff was a little cold (perhaps because they are all European) and the room service staff screwed up our order on the morning of the funeral so some in our party were starving through a funeral and burial service that went into the mid-afternoon.  The hotel knew this was the case, but room service basically gave a "too bad" type response when they received a call asking for the food that morning.  Additionally, the hotel manager wrote an unsatisfactory response by email.  

Also, we looked out on apartment buildings which allowed no light into the rooms and the hallways and lobby were old and small.  Not inviting at all. Not an ounce of anything that felt modern.  With the European staff you would think they would learn something from some of European hotels I assume a few of them have worked in that would hopefully be of the caliber that this hotel would like to be in.

There are plenty of small hotels who would have gotten this right considering the circumstances.  I would never stay here again, period.

title: Nice but too tight for comfort
text:
If you want a room with a view this is probably not the best choice. Rooms
Are nice but small. They are nicely furnished and maid service is exceptional.  Restaurant is really small & tables do not offer privacy. Front desk is nice & courteous. 

are nice but small & ceiling height is low.

title: Luxury Living
text: Amazing experience! Stellar location, luxury at its finest, gracious & courteous staff. It feels like a home away from home in the heart of a quiet Upper East Side neighborhood. We loved that we could walk to Central Park and enjoy all the shopping on Madison & 5th.

title: Reservations
text:
Have stayed at The Lowell on 2 prior occasions with excellent service .
Planned to stay again however, was completely turned off by their surcharges for terraces or fireplaces ($ 200) which are not stated on their room pricing guide.  What a ripoff!  Not
sure if that includes fees for lighting the fireplace .  What if you bring your own wood and starter logs and matches?
Too bad, because we really liked the place...Oh, well.

title: Quiet Chic Boutique Hotel in Upper East side
text: Every time I have stayed here I have a wonderful time either Business or leisure trip. The tasteful Decor functional and extra comfortable Rooms with every possible detail you can ever imagine. The Hotel always has fresh flowers impeccable bedding and linens. The suites make you feel like in a Dream with amazing Bathrooms and state of the art Kitchens. All suites are individually decorated and unique. My favorite is the Garden suite that has a wood burning fireplace and amazing views of Manhattan. Tea time is a delight here in The Lowell and the concierge is among the best ones in NYC.

title: Exquisite, elegant, townhouse living on the UES
text:
More like settling into in a wealthy friend's elegant townhouse than being in a hotel, except that your friend also has a great concierge, warm and friendly receptionists, hustling doormen, superb maid service, a terrific little restaurant, high tea, etc, etc. And your friend also has a perfect UES location on 63rd between Park and Madison.

Compared to other UES boutique hotels (e.g. The Carlyle), the Lowell feels even more intimate and personal, and in my experience, the rooms are larger, better-appointed and more elegant. Examine, for example, the very thoughtful little collections of excellent coffee table books in each room. Plus the orchids. And the tasteful art objects. And the truly great bathrooms, with huge tubs, great separate showers, and toiletries by Dina De Luca Chartouni. Not to mention the amazingly comfortable beds...

All in all, a perfect boutique hotel

title: Great hotel on upper east side
text: I had always heard nice things about the Lowell Hotel.  Well they were true.  This is a cozy place with a great staff.  Very friendly and knowledgeable concierge, Natasha was great.  Rooms are well appointed and very clean.  We were offered champagne upon arrival, a nice treat after a long journey to the hotel.  I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Home Away From Hone!
text:
Great boutique hotel in NYC. Great location in Upper East Side, between Madison Ave.
Excellent for shopping.  The staff are amazing, courteous & helpful. I usually like more modern hotel but this is just classic luxury & elegant. We were fortunate that our roon had a deck. Highly recommended!

title: Very Disappointing
text: I had heard great things about the Lowell and we were seeking a charming boutique hotel on the Upper East Side.  Unfortunately our experience was extremely disappointing and we will not be back.  It is a small hotel with a charming lobby.  My room, however, was old, tired and desperately in need of an upgrade.  The light colored rug was badly stained which made it appear that the room was dirty and the furnishings appeared tired and in need of replacement.  There was a small kitchenette (probably an old closet) with a minibar and a counter but there was no coffee maker. The coffee maker would have been very welcome considering that although the hotel claims it has 24 hour room service, you cannot get any hot food prior to 7am.  On the positive side, the bathroom had been renovated and the shower was wonderful.  I practically choked when I saw the nightly rate, however—I would have found it very overpriced even if the room had been amazing. There are far better options in New York City.

title: Classic, Luxurious, AMAZING Bathrooms
text:
I usually prefer more modern hotels, but I wound up LOVING the Lowell. I stayed here for 4 days on business, and it's now one of my favorite places to stay in Manhattan. 

THE ROOMS:
Very classic - wooden beds and end tables with furnishings that almost have an upscale country vibe ... but it's tasteful, beautiful, and the gives an overall feeling of comfort and luxury. The bathrooms are amazing ... I'm almost pickier about hotel bathrooms than the bedroom, and these are among the best I've seen in NYC. They're HUGE, with a big beautiful shower, huge separate bathtub, and lots of mirrors. 

THE SERVICE:
Courteous & prompt - exactly what you'd expect of a luxury hotel. The room service menu is great (they even had a menu for dogs, including Filet Mignon ... I'm not kidding) and the food was fab. 

THE LOCATION:
Perfect. The hotel itself felt quiet (it's small size probably adds to this) and out of the insane crowds, but it's very central.

Loved!!

title: Sanctuary in crazy Manhattan
text:
The Lowell is a home away from home boutique hotel.Well situated between Park and Madison between Upper East and Midtown,yet in a quiet residential tree lined street. The staff are warm and friendly and clearly enjoy excelling at their job.
The concierge John is knowledgeable,professional and an excellent source of information.
Breakfast is excellent,although somewhat expensive but the service and ambiance delightful.
A good spot if you are in New York on business or holiday.

title: A relaxing, luxurious afternoon tea!
text: Afternoon tea in the Pembrooke Room at the Lowell Hotel is absolutely wonderful. The Pembrooke is tucked away on the 2nd floor and if you do not know about it, you would not find this lovely place. The room is beautifully set up for quiet conversation.  Tea is served between 3 and 6pm and reservations are needed. You will not be disappointed. There is a lovely selection of teas and the service is exceptional. The accompaniments with tea are a selection of savories and sweets, plus the exceptional warm scones served with fruit jams, lemon curd and cream. Each teapot was refilled with hot water and also second helpings of scones were offered. A pleasant afternoon spent in NYC but in the Pembrooke, it felt like we were so far away from all the noise and city excitement. Lovely, just lovely!

title: Small luxury hotel
text: The Lowell is a fabulous intimate hotel.  Our king room faced the interior but did not mind as we did not spend a lot of time in the room.  The king bedded room was furnished comfortably.  Coffee bar, large closet and large bath in NYC standards.  The bath had separate tub and shower and a double sink.  The concierge was most helpful in securing dining reservations.  The front desk staff and doorman were always welcoming.  The location is great if you want to be near great museums and shopping.  The formal dining room is small and open for breakfast and pre theater dining only.  The Post House which is connected to the hotel was closed for renovation. I would highly recommend The Lowell and will stay there again.

title: Luxury European Boutique Service on the East Side
text:
The Lowell experience begins on the sidewalk where friendly and professional doormen greet you and welcome you inside to the front desk.  The lobby is small and well appointed with plenty of seating, refreshments.

The staff here will take the time to get to know your name, so if you are moving at the pace of a New Yorker, prepare to slow down a bit and enjoy connecting with genuinely friendly and helpful people.

A bellman will escort you to your spacious room, complete with kitchenette, Frette bed linens, towels and robes, and a stunning bathroom.  Soaker tub, steam shower, TV and phone.  Every detail is attended to as you might expect from a luxury property.

Breakfast at The Lowell is another experience in expert hospitality, I loved Marty the maitre d'/waiter who ran a tight ship and was a sweetheart.  Here again, even though my stay was brief the staff took the time to get to know me, hand delivering a FedEx package to me at breakfast and greeting me by name.

Highly recommend this property!

title: Boutique Hotel in NYC
text:
If you are looking for a boutique hotel in NYC try the Lowell.  This hotel is well located on the posh Upper East Side.  It is a member of the Leading Hotels of  the World, which is not an easy thing to get!

Location, Location, Location!

If you aren’t necessarily in love the hustle and bustle of city life, but want to be near it, this ritzy boutique hotel is 1 block from Central Park, and only 2 blocks from the nearest subway station.  It is only  8 minute walk to all the 5th Avenue's shops. 

The newly renovated rooms, are tastefully decorated in calming tones, have free WiFi, and feature marble bathrooms, flat-screen TV’s and are well appointed with complimentary water, embroidered linens and a good desk for those that need to do some work. Room service is available 24/7.  AND a working wood burning fireplace !

Amenities include a guest-only fitness center, and an elegant restaurant that offers breakfast, brunch, afternoon tea and dinner, in addition to an extensive cocktail menu.

Although not as casual as Cheers and much more formal, this is the place that knows you by name when you enter the door, and is happy to address all of your needs.  The level of service is unbeatable. Also unique for a NYC hotel?......No noise. It's a cute residential neighborhood far enough away to be out of the throngs, but close enough to everything to get around via public transportation.

It's a beautiful hotel boutique hotel with great staff.   The location of the hotel is adequate for shopping, sightseeing, and public transportation.

title: Hotel boutique
text: O hotel não é muito grande e possui um atendimento personalizado e impecável. Impecável, desde o saguão sempre enfeitado com lindas flores, até os quartos, muito amplos e aconchegantes. O melhor do hotel, sem dúvida alguma é o café da manha ou o brunch! A localização é ótima.

title: This hotel keeps getting better!
text:
This was my second stay at the hotel and I got to experience a different season in the neighborhood but also a different room type! I stayed in a Junior Suite designed by Michael Smith. I cannot emphasise enough how amazing the staff, service and quality of my stay was. The Lowell along with it's stunning location knows how to win over our hearts. Not once did any of the staff members forget my name. I was always greeted warmly by everyone, they ensured that I knew my way around but at the same time the communication is not stuffy and it is all very genuine. 
I am addicted and cannot wait to be back!

title: Elegant and relaxing
text: I checked into this hotel when my apartment was not available. My short stay was absolutely enchanting.  The friendly staff, the delightful room service and cleanliness of my room was exquisite.  I have stayed in many hotels on the upper east side,and highly recommend this boutique hotel for you're stay.  Wonderful and fantastic location.

title: Caro, elegante pero con fallas
text:
Estuvimos 3 noches.
El hotel esta muy bien ubicado.
Una decoración muy bien cuidada.
El desayuno carisimo pero delicioso.
La pieza muy pequeña para el precio y con un aire acondicionado en la mitad de la pieza que además era tremendamente ruidoso.
El personal excelente.

En resumen creo que hay mejores opciones por este precio.

title: Hidden Gem
text: The Lowell is the hotel of choice for the in the know traveler.  I have stayed at this hotel many times and it never fails to disappoint.  You are always welcomed as a family member returning home.  The rooms and suites are an oasis after a long business day in NY.  A true NY gem.

title: stunning atmosphere
text: this was my second time visiting The Lowell hotel , The staff is very welcoming  from the moment you walk in the door your greeted by name , front desk staff is always so welcoming and interested to ensure that you are well versed in the area , Jesus the bell man knew me by name everytime i saw him and had great recommendations for places to go see as well as dinner recommendations . stay at the lowell you wont be dissapointed

title: 洗練されています。
text:
エントランス付近はそれほど広くなく、こじんまりとしていましたが、泊まった時期がUS OPENの時だったので、チェックインしている方々がテニス関係の方が多く、カジュアルウエアでも品があり洗練された感じで客層も良かったです。
お部屋は広さ十分で、特に、バスルームがウオークイン・クローゼットと繋がっていて両方合わせると２０m２くらいありました。バスルームでエクササイズをする事が出来るくらいでした。
窓も大きく取られておりマンハッタンの風景を望む事が出来、部屋に長居したくなるような贅沢な作りでした。

title: Hotel boutique, poucos quartos com localizaçao ímpar!
text:
Hotel pequeno, aconchegante, serviço impecável , quartos amplos iluminados , alguns com varanda com vista para o Central Park, concierge realmente funciona.
Oferecem um serviço de chá da tarde que é imperdível!

title: Excellent service, facilities, location!
text: I have stayed for my 3rd time and I think they deserve a very positive feedback. From the arrival, (doorman), to the departure, all the staff is absolutely amazing. Rooms are very comfortable, bathroom spacious, nice amenities from a very nice GM who I had the pleasure of meeting to say Than You!

title: European Charm. American Efficiency. Great Location.
text:
It's expensive (but hey, this is Manhattan) but still offers good value for anyone looking for luxury combined with charm and personal service in the heart of the upper east side. It feels smaller than it is - and in this case that's a very good thing. The feel is intimate, and that makes you feel at home from the moment you check in.

Until their new restaurant opens, food service is restricted to breakfast, afternoon tea, brunch, and pre-theatre. No lunch, and no full dinner service. But the brekkie and brunch are superb (served in the delightful Pembroke Room), as is room-service (which is available all day).

The UES location is ideal - you can walk to the important art museums and Bloomingdales, and Central Park is just steps away. And upper Madison Avenue, which is the best shopping precinct in the world, is right at the door.

I don't know why we've never stayed here before. We will from now on...

title: Another Perfect Stay
text: This amazing hotel never disappoints me.  If staying on the upper east side, this is the only place I will stay.  From the moment you are greeted exiting the taxi, you are treated warmly and graciously.  I highly recommend staying no where else in this part of NYC.

title: Cosy and convenient
text:
Stayed here for a week while on business in NY and really enjoyed it. Lovely small, intimate boutique hotel in a great location and very convenient for all the main stores. The staff were very attentive and the team serving breakfast were lovely. 
All in all a very comfortable stay. Would recommend to anyone looking for a quiet, cosy hotel.

title: A Peaceful Haven
text: Staying here is like being at home or visiting a wealthy friend with great taste. A true Oasis in busy, hectic Gotham. Great access to all the great venues of the Upper East Side. Stay here if you're looking for a home away from home in NYC.

title: $3000.00 a night  and no bath?
text:
My husband and I were excited to be trying out a new hotel in Manhattan as we go there several times a year and have yet to find a favorite spot. We researched the Lowell and thought it looked like a good place to stay for a couple of nights. We reserved a two bedroom suite as one of us snores! My husband arrived before I did and checked into our $3000.00 per night suite expecting a lovely, well appointed room which was cheerful in décor. We were both disappointed in the rooms as the colors were in muted shades of brown and beige with little relief from this dreary color scheme Though the hotel claims to have recently redecorated the rooms, we didn't think they were as nice as we had hoped. As a matter of fact, one of the bedrooms had a picture on the wall that was so disturbing I had to cover it with a towel. The ominous face depicted in the painting was enough for any normal person to suffer nightmares.
We ordered room service for dinner as it was late and we were tired. The dinner was inedible as the chicken breast I had ordered was so tough I had to ask for help in cutting it and the salad was dry and wilted. My husband's steak was also sub par.
I decided the only thing that would make me feel better would be a lovely hot bath but this was not to be so as the tub would not function properly. I find this is the case in many older hotel rooms and it is a pet peeve of mine. The bath tub drain doesn't work and therefore one is unable to fill the tub. As it was midnight I didn't want to trouble the staff so I made a makeshift stopper which barely worked though it did make me laugh. $3000.00 a night and no bath!
In the morning both my husband and I asked the front desk staff to have the situation rectified. My husband was working in the room that morning and a repairman arrived stating he was there to fix the toilet. After informing him that the toilet was fine and that the bath tub drain was the problem, he went to work. After ten minutes he stated he had taken care of the problem. My husband showed him there was still a problem and he stated that it would be fixed. 
Later that day when I returned happily expecting to have a pleasant bath before we went out for the evening, I found the problem still existed. We called the front desk and yet another person was sent to do the repairs. This time he fixed it.
The hotel room had a small closet type kitchen off the living room which was supposed to be equipped with coffee and creamer. We had to ask for the coffee on our second day and were told the hotel had run out. Luckily we had a very energetic room service waiter who took some from an unoccupied room.
The hotel seems to not understand the idea of preparedness for its guests and seems to be cutting corners in odd places. For example: at night the turn down staff(which arrived the second night at our door at 10:30PM) bring bottled water for the bedside. Beware! if you don't drink the water it is removed by the daytime maids. 
One of our rooms had a working thermostat but the other remained at a frigid temperature despite many attempts to alter it.
We were very disappointed in our stay at the Lowell and will not be returning. For the price, the service, rooms and atmosphere did not live up to our expectations.

title: Beautiful Boutique Hotel
text: From the very elegant lobby to the stylish rooms everything was just perfect.  It is located in a very quiet location but still being very close to everything.  The hotel staff were all very pleasant and helpful.  We will definitely be back.

title: Quiet Sophistication, and you do pay for it...
text:
This is high luxury, though very understated. It's classic elegance. The hotel is decorated in such a way it makes you feel like you have been there for a while-except its pristine clean. It feels like a sumptuous home away from home. 

My husband and I had originally booked a standard Lowell King room through Jetsetter but we were upgraded to a Specialty Suite simply because we expressed we'd hoped to have a fireplace. Since the staff member, Maria, sincerely wanted to ensure our satisfaction, they gave us the upgrade at no extra charge. We had the Hollywood Suite which has two bathrooms, 1 king size bedroom, a kitchenette, conference room(or dining room/sitting room if you will), a living room and multiple closets. It was the only fireplace room available. Maria wanted us to be happy- and so it was. That to me is exceptional service. 

We were greeted with an enthusiastic smile by the front desk attendant upon arrival. I think Laura was her name. She was so sweet. When we entered our room we were happy to find the complimentary champagne, water, wine, cheese and fruit plate waiting for us. One attendant took to showing us around (we loved all of the doors) while another lit our fire.  The attendant who gave the tour told us the wood costs $30 dollars(more on this later).  Then they quickly took their leave after bidding us goodnight. 

The views from the 13th floor were amazing. The fireplace was amazing There was no smoke -which was shocking considering the depth of it and we had more than enough wood. There were 3 TV's, several shelves of books and we brought our Chrome Cast to hook up to the Flat screen to watch our own movies. We were both SO pleased... Until the next evening -when hours after check out they charged us an additional 90 or so dollars for the use of the firewood!That kind of left us both with a bitter taste after an otherwise lovely experience. We are far from wealthy and had made this reservation on a strict budget. It was a special night for us as in two days my husband, who is battling cancer, would be going through his last round of chemo before seeing the results. While grateful for the upgrade and all that came with it, we had not been expecting the additional charge since we were told it cost $30 to use the wood with no further specifics given. Had we known we would have used less. A silly upset, I know, after the wonderful upgrade. I really am grateful for that. I just feel people should be aware.

For out of towners... If you want quiet luxury and have the money to spare, You will love this hotel. It's a block away from Central Park and also close enough to shopping and museums(but not amidst the loud hustle and bustle of Columbus Circle on the west side). They also serve up delicious afternoon tea with sophistication (That is super expensive as well. We couldn't afford it). 

This visit was very special to us to begin with but the staff here knocked it out of the park with the upgrade. I am so happy we chose to make the Lowell hotel our "staycation spot" this Valentine's day.

title: Elegant boutique hotel in the Upper East Side
text:
We spent three of the coldest nights NYC has experienced in years at the Lowell. I mention this because it's about 20 blocks from mid-town, so if you're planning a theatre trip (as we did) or expect to spend most of your time in that part of town, be prepared for a 25 to 30 minute walk each way. I found that I couldn't do it without ducking into a couple stores along the way to avoid hypothermia.

That said, I have no problem walking and would have found the stroll quite enjoyable during warmer months. The location is very quiet and in a very upscale neighborhood two blocks off the park. In fact the closest "tourist" attraction is the Central Park Zoo just a short walk away, and I chose to visit for the first time. The view is unremarkable. The only thing we could see from our window was the work-in-progress they call the Icon.

The front desk staff are extremely warm and friendly, especially Jesus at the front door. I'd forgotten to print theatre tickets and boarding passes, and they were happy to do so for me.

We stayed in a Lowell Room, which was just right for us. Neutral browns and dark hardwood floors gave the room a sophisticated, masculine atmosphere (in fact, the hotel overall has a masculine feel to it). The thermostat was easy to operate and actually worked. The room had the largest "mini" bar of any hotel I've stayed in (pictures included). The bedding and linens were extremely comfortable and I slept perfectly all three nights. 

The bathroom fantastic: heated white marble floors and walls, enormous tub, equally large separate shower. 

Room service is 24 hours, and we took advantage of it one late night when we both got the munchies. :-) The Pembroke Room was, if anything, a bit too precious. I hate to say it, but it reminded me more of a funeral parlor than anything else. Very little natural light, decked out in Victorian excess with the dulcet, over-sentimental tones of Tchaikovsky and Dvořák piped through the speakers. I could see how it would appeal to some people, but it is more a tea room than a proper restaurant, and is limited in its offering. I will say that the brunch we sat down to was delicious: the eggs benedict with black truffle was knockout.

Additionally, this hotel does not have a bar. So keep that in mind if you're the sort (we are) who like to come back to the hotel after a long night and have a drink or two before retiring to the room. You're left to the luxurious minibar which is, predictably, quite expensive ($8 for Dean & DeLuca gummi bears). We ended up at the Pierre for a nightcap.

All in all, this is a very classy establishment and I recommend it highly for people who want elegance and luxury away from the crowds and noise of mid-town.

title: Just okay
text:
The Lowell is a lovely upper east side apartment turned hotel I would guess. The character is quaint and the floors squeak. The room and sitting room with fireplace were okay on a cold February night. Just remember they charge for the fire... They charge for everything! I've stayed at numerous hotels in New York and I've never had a bill for 70.00 for 2 bagels and coffee. The day before we had a basket of pastries and coffee and it was around the same price?? There are no convenient restaurants. It has a kitchenette with a pot for boiling water but instant coffee, yuk! 
No stores even markets close by either to stock up on things for your kitchenette. It is quiet but the beds uncomfortable. You can do so much better for the money. Small bathroom. Overall needs a redo.

title: Hidden Gem, One of the Best
text:
My bridesmaids and I stayed here the night before my wedding and also used the hotel room as we got ready for the big day just two weekends ago. From start to finish, the hotel concierge, staff, and reservation office was nothing but wonderful, incredibly helpful, and just downright sweet. Despite my having booked a smaller suite, they kindly upgraded us to a larger one, worked with me to find the room with best lighting for photos, and extended the check out to ensure we had plenty of time to get ready. All staff members were informed of our names and greeted us so whenever we encountered them. Little touches like greeting us with complementary juices & champagne upon arrival and a truly heartfelt, handwritten note with congratulations and best wishes, accompanied by additional snacks made all the difference in calming nerves and preparing us for what was a crazy but joyful occasion. My only regret is not having enough time to thank the entire team at the Hotel and take everything in more fully. My husband and I will surely be returning for a staycation. 

Other notes: the lobby is small but inviting. The rooms on the other hand are surprisingly spacious and elegantly decorated. The beds are one of the best I've ever slept on. Further, the Lowell Hotel is part of the Leading Hotels of the World collection. Having stayed at another LHW hotel not too long ago, I was expecting that same level of great service I experienced previously. However the Lowell Hotel easily trumped any expectations and blew that other hotel out of the water. 

Thank you again to the entire team at the Lowell Hotel!

title: piccolo hotel di lusso
text:
Frequento questo fantastico hotel ogni volta che vado a new york.
E' un piccolo hotel vicino a central park e alle maggiori attrazioni di New York (5° strada, madison...)
le stanze sono stupendamente arredate, silenziose e sempre ben pulite.
Il personale gentile e cordiale, e a differenza dei grandi hotel, con un'attenzione particolare per ciascun ospite.
La colazione alla carta, ottima e di livello.
Il connesso ristorante Post House è il posto migliore dove gustare carne di altissimo livello in un ambiente esclusivo fuori dai soliti posti turistici.
Consigliatissimo, per un'esperienza esclusiva a new york.

title: Another flawless stay at The Lowell
text:
After staying at the St. Regis and Peninsula on our visits to NYC, we tried The Lowell several years ago and never looked back. This was our fourth stay and it was flawless. 

The hotel is elegant, quiet and understated, situated on a lovely street about a block from Central Park. We reserved two rooms, one for my husband and myself, and another for relatives. Both rooms were large, beautifully decorated and absolutely spotless. The staff, without exception, were friendly and professional. The continental breakfast (which was included in the price) was delivered on time with white linens, flowers and delicious pastries. We all felt very pampered; It was like staying at someone's lovely home.  

Nothing is too much for the great team.  For example, we asked if it would be possible to record a football game for my husband and it was done with no problem.  What other hotel in NYC would do  that?

I can't recommend this hotel highly enough.  Thank you to everyone at The Lowell for making our special trip so memorable.

title: A must for high tea.
text: If you're a lover of high tea this is the place to go.  The "tea room" is small and cozy, with approximately twelve well spaced tables.  The tables are well appointed with crisp  white linen, crystal stemware and silver flatware., and of course flowers. Lovely Chinese  vases are placed around the room, the draperies are silk and the seating is very comfortable.  I ordered the Imperial Tea which consists of champagne, caviar, tea sandwiches, (very tasty) scones and petit fours, my daughter had the standard Tea  which was the same as the Imperial Tea (sans the caviar and champagne) and a glass of wine.My three year old grandson had a children's tea, which was peanut better and jelly, ham and cheese and egg salad sandwiches along with hot chocolate.  The service was very attentive and friendly.   Our bill was $185.00 with the tip.

title: Gem of the Upper East Side
text: I had a wonderful stay at the Lowell Hotel. An experience I won't forget. Starting from reception and leading up to the room, the service was impeccable and the hotel also offers a welcome drink in which case I ordered a coffee. The rooms are spacious, extremely comfortable andyou also get a coffee making facility which not all hotels offer in New York. The hotel is the only one in New York offering wood burning fire places which I thoroughly enjoyed having lit up! I must mention that even the amenities in the bathroom are unique and its refreshing to see a hotel using local New York brands that really give one the insider experience. My room was overlooking the 63rd Street, a lovely quiet neighborhood yet walking distance to all you need in New York such as Barneys, Bloomingdales, Park Avenue and some wonderful cafes and gems of Lexington Avenue! If you really want a local New York stay in one of the best hotels in New York, The Lowell is the place to visit!

title: Un petit bijou à New York
text: Nous sommes restés dans cet hotel pour les fêtes de Noel. L'emplacement est tout simplement idéal pour ceux qui recherchent un peu de tranquilité dans cet ville somme toute bruyante. Situé sur la 63ème rue entre Madison et Park, le trafic est minimal est et vous n'avez pas les nuisances des klaxons matinaux et différentes sirènes de polices. A proximité de Central Park, des musées et des magasins,l'emplacement de cet hotel un endroit idéal. Vous poussez la porte, et vous entrez dans un hotel magnifiquement décorée avec une réception très chaleureuse. Les enfants ont tous été accueillis avec des petits présents pour Noel, une superbe attention. Le staff est incroyablement accueillant et souriant, une mention spécial au portier Jesus ! Les chambres sont très spacieuses et surtout magnifiquement décoré, les salle de bains sont au standard Européen, à savoir vrai baignoire et vraie douche et non pas un mix des deux situé à 30 cm du sol !!  Le romm service est excellent ainsi que les petits déjeuners dans la Pembroke Room qui ressemble à un véritable bonbon anglais et au salon de thé de Fortnum & Masons ! Hotel à taille humaine, idéalement placé, staff gentil et agréable toujours prêt à vous aider, décoration chaleureuse, un endroit dans lequel il fait bon passer du temps !! Nous y retournerons sans aucune hésitation

title: We had "high tea" in the "tea room" on the second floor
text: We enjoyed ourselves despite having to wait 45 minutes for our 4pm confirmed reservation. The staff was most apologetic and noted that "certain guests were dawdling." The service was very good and we enjoyed the array of finger sandwiches, cookies and caviar. The room is quite small and cozy but there is no view. We will return again. Note, as with most outings in Manhattan, this is a very expensive venue; i.e., $85 per person for tea and crumpets, as it were.

title: A wedding to remember..
text: We recently held our wedding reception at The Lowell and what a pleasure it was to do so. Eric Dupaix and the team were simply marvellous both in helping to prepare for our special day and on the day itself, we really couldn't have asked for more. We booked the Lowell suite with terrace for 2 nights where we also held our drinks reception (it accommodated our 13 guests perfectly) this was followed by a wonderful 5 course dinner in the Pembroke room. Their attention to detail, high standard of service and wonderful ambience was a delight to experience. If you are seeking an intimate, stylish NYC wedding venue then look no further. Thank you again Eric, Alexandra and all the team.

title: Excellent Service - Cozy & Homely - Great Location for shopping
text:
Booked the Deluxe Junior Suite through Leading Hotels of the World site. It has photos of a four poster bed and a 2 seater sofa and a small balcony window. (did not get that). 

Although the seating area was only 1 arm chair, and I did not get the balcony window that I thought I would get for $1400+ per night. (breakfast was included)

But...

Excellent services & warmest welcome with breezy check-in services made up for that. They know you from the moment you stepped out from the car. Impressive. 

Room was nice and big, lots of windows and bright. Biggest bathroom I have seen in this price category. Well stocked kitchenette, very yummy & good selection of snacks. Tate's chocolate chip cookies was the best! I have never seen so much drinks and juices stocked up in a NYC hotel!!!

Breakfast was included, and was told I could eat $100 per day for free. Not that I did. Buttermilk pancakes with ripe strawberries, maple syrup and bacon! Really nice coffee. Showed that they put their heart to serving you.

Location wise - I booked this place for their proximity to Hermes on Madison. So near!!! 2 min stroll round the corner!! So happy. I was really lucky to have gotten a Hermes Kelly in etoupe. I can't believe it. This is my good luck hotel.

Hotel has assisted in shipping over-shopped items back to London for me. No hassles. Very pleasant. 

I have nothing to complain about except perhaps if you want to know where to go for well Halloween decorated streets and neighbourhoods, ask the doorman not the concierge.
Doorman said : W69th street party. Concierge said: Soho. (Doorman was right)

title: Delightful Boutique Hotel
text: We recently spent three nights at the Lowell. Great location between Madison and Park in mid-town Manhattan with easy access to Central Park. Service was outstanding, from the moment we arrived to the moment we checked out. A cosy and intimate feeling exudes the hotel. The room we had was quiet and well appointed. The toilet area was quite small - not conducive for larger bodies! Not sure if this is in all the rooms? Apparently each room is individually decorated. Ours we subdued and inviting. Breakfasts in the elegantly decorated dining room were pleasant. Service was excellent and the choice for breakfast items, huge! We also enjoyed an Afternoon Tea in the dining room prior to going to the theatre. A great way to  tide oneself over till dinner post-show.

title: A Welcome Retreat
text: The Lowell feels like home...if your home means luxurious bedding, spotless and courteous housekeeping, beautiful accommodations, and a knowledgeable and gracious staff to assist you with any and all issues. The lobby is beautiful and cozy, a welcome retreat from a busy day in New York City. The hotel is quiet and peaceful, and rooms are perfectly decorated with understated elegance. The location is perfectly nestled in the Upper East Side and close to many attractions, restaurants, and shopping. The concierge is a magician when it comes to difficult tickets or reservations! This hotel wears its well-earned badge of a Leading Hotel of the World.

title: My home from home
text: This is a very understated hotel which will make you feel like you live in an upmarket apartment block in the city.  VBCJJ's review is spot on.  I always enjoy my stays here when in NYC but it is not for you if you enjoy lively hotels or the glitz and glam of the NYC grand dame hotels.  This is a very traditional solid hotel in a very good location for the UES or mid-town.   The restaurant is a little underwhelming and the breakfast is slow.  Otherwise the service is fabulous and the suites and the fireplaces (in winter) and/or the suites and the terraces (in summer) cannot be beaten.

title: Understated Elegance
text: The Lowell is an Elegant Hotel that is discreet and private. It is a Classic Hotel that is for those that prefer not being exposed to any Fashionable Trends in its design and clientele...
